name: USS KIDD Veterans Museum - Temporarily Closed
address: 305 S River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Great displays, clean and polite staff, facilities are great and clean restrooms.  If you can get on one of the tours on board, it's extremely informative.  Our group loved the info and historical significance. Kids seemed to like it too and you get to go to most places on the ship and examine everything.

Great museum with well preserved historical artifacts. I really enjoyed how the curators have chosen to display ships of different types to give visitors an idea of how important naval defenses are to national security. Local heroes are highlighted and honored as well. I highly recommend a visit to the museum to anyone!!! If your kids are younger, all about how they and a group of friends can spend the night on the ship.

A wonderful tribute to those who served. The museum was great, highly interactive and well kept. Parking was easy. I could park 10 feet from the door. The gift shop had some very nice things. The memorials to those who died in Vietnam and in many other conflicts was touching and serene. And the battleship was well kept. The tour was top notch because you could go to probably 85% of the ship. There weren’t many rules or ropes preventing you from really getting a scale of the Kidd. The sick bay, the radio room, the guns, the showers and bathrooms, the crew quarters and the various decks of the ship all were kept in really good shape and made for a great tour. If you haven’t been and you’re driving through Baton Rouge, you should absolutely spend a few hours here

Had a great time.  Haven't been here since I was a kid.  My wife had never been and she really enjoyed it.  Didn't realize it but by the time we were almost done looking at the ship 2.5hrs had passed, and we were moving pretty quick.  
It's something you can definitely sink some time in to if you try to see everything.  We didn't spend much time taking photos, but there is lots of things to photograph.

Self directed tour. Fascinating look at what it would have been like to serve on a destroyer in WWII. Must not have been an easy experience for those sailors. Worth a look if you are into military stuff and don't mind climbing around in close quarters

name: Mike the Tiger's Habitat
address: 16 N Stadium Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: This is a wonderful exhibit that shows the actual tiger in his enclosure. It is near the stadium and on campus to that it is easy to get to. There is plenty of parking nearby and it allows lots people to see Mike. It is one of the best places to see a tiger up close. Both times that I stopped by the enclosure, Mike was outside and sitting on the rock making picture taking easy. I think this is a must see for anyone in the area.
We always love seeing Mike the tiger!  He has a wonderful habitat and there are plenty of places around it to help you get a great view of him. My 10 year old took this photo of Mike.🙂

Always fun seeing Mike. Especially since he is a younger version and very spunky. He was extremely playful. He was playing in the water and looking through the glass. He got very up close and personal. We visit here often.

Mike is a good sport. He's the local bengal(?) tiger which is LSU's mascot. He lives in a nice habitat accessible to the public to come admire such a majestic animal. He was up and about and lounged around.  He actually looked at me turning his head 180 degrees when I called him. I was not aware how pointed and chiseled a tiger's head is from it's profile and how round it is when it faces you. Because he is relatively close behind two wire mesh fences you can feel his presence.  If you are in the area drop by, you will enjoy it. The students are scurrying to and from places, however, my daughter asked a young lady to take photos and she was impressively kind and attractive.

Came to see the complete dismantling of Texas A&M and enjoyed every second of seeing Burrow rip through these guys. The Tiger Habitat is amazing, and Tiger Stadium is the place to be on a Fall Saturday night. What an experience. Can't wait to get back.

name: Louisiana's Old State Capitol
address: 100 North Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: The castle architecture is amazing! The spiral staircase is magnificent and the stained glass dome is beautiful.  It's free to tour and well worth the time. The museum contains some fascinating stories about Louisiana and the men and women who played an important part of Louisiana's history.

Last April I was in town from Michigan for a week visiting Baton Rouge and I  had a great time visiting the Louisiana Old State Capital. It was a beautiful sight, and I got to learn a lot of history and info about it. I would recommend if you are visiting Baton Rouge that you come check out the Louisiana Old State Capital.
Beautiful building with an amazing interior stained glass dome! Full of useful historical information. Well worth a visit.
If I could hide in a room and live here at night- I totally would. Is nice and has great air conditioning. The architecture is cool too.

My tour was cut off prematurely due to personal reasons, but what I saw of it was absolutely stunning! It was free, beautiful, and absolutely enjoyable. If you enjoy historic venues, this place is a must-see!I especially like how they will change different venues to make sure that the venue is always fresh.

name: Capitol Park Museum
address: 660 N 4th St, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: This museum was no nice! Being from Louisiana it was great to visit this museum on the history of my state. The exhibits are very detailed and give so much history. I learned a lot by visiting this museum.

Two floors museum. First floor - history of Louisiana from French time to the modern and exposition covering whole economic diversity of the state and the second floor is abundant presence of the different cultural phenomenas of Louisiana. Different regions, different aspects: from voodoo culture and jazz funeral to Mardi Gras and different variety of music. 

Sorry for many words, but the place is amazing, must see.
Always a terrific treat! So much information, you learn something new Everytime you visit. Staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeble too.
A must visit to appreciate what a rich historical Louisiana means to you all, in-state and out-of-state!
I love visiting this museum. There is so much to see and take in. I always learn something new. One of my favorite places.

name: BREC's Bluebonnet Swamp Nature Center
address: 10503 N Oak Hills Pkwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: This place is awesome and so pretty. You could hear owls all while walking through the stunning swamp. It was very easy to find and isn’t expensive to visit. However, I’m giving it 3 stars because we wanted to buy something in the nature center and they had already “closed down the system” even though they were still open for 25 more minutes. So my family, and the 3 other families in there who ALSO wanted to buy something could not do so all because the two girls working the counter wanted to leave right as the center closed. Super annoying. Definitely go visit here, but make sure it’s an hour before they close if you want to buy something.

I was very disappointed with the service Jessica Guthrie, Manager promised during the walk through of the rental facility prior to my daughter-in-law baby shower. When I arrived on site at the facility, their staff member was very unprofessional and rude after I had brought my concerns regarding the uncleanliness of the facility. The floor of the entrance was dirty, the carpet needed vacuum. The tables and chairs was not setup as promised during the walk through. The kitchen had roach eggs and spiders on the counter tops. There were nasty dishes left in the sink with dirty wash sponge. The refrigerator was not clean or cleared out. The bathrooms was not clean. This is suppose to be a place where kids have day camp. If your child go to this place, I would think twice about taking them there. Then the female staff person had the nerve to check me off to see if I cleaned the area before leaving. My crew had to take 30 minutes to clean before setup. In the contract,  I was only given one hour setup time.
 Therefore, we only had 30 minutes to setup, not fair. What’s the purpose of having a hour setup time, if the rental guest have to come in to clean and setup their space. It doesn’t make since to give the guest one hour  setup time when you have not kept your end of the agreement. Also, you need to get rid of that staff member girl that was overseeing 12/29/19, Sunday. She was unprofessional and does not need to be in that position. She gives your company a poor representation. For this reason, I will never rent this facility again.

 By the way, let me give you qualities a representative staff member should have: someone that is warm welcoming and inviting with a smile, willing to make sure the guest is satisfied with their space, and helpful in resulting issues that my arrive in a professional manner.
Worth a visit if you live in the area.  Not the beat scenery.  Go to Tickfaw State Park for good trails in a swamp setting.

Great nearby spot to get away from the city vibe. Bring binoculars and a lunch find a bench along the trail and just wait for the scene to unfold. Kinda wierd to see buildings along the library trail but still a great little spot in the woods.
It's a great little hiking trail through a swamp, with wooden walkways for the wet bits. Surprisingly scenic for being in the middle of the city

name: Louisiana Art & Science Museum
address: 100 S River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: This is an entertaining spot to visit. The facility is impeccable as were the employees.  Its right smack in the middle of things so you can reach just about everything that you may want in the downtown area. I guess my favorite was the skull of a triceratops which is easily viewable to provide one with the magnitude in size and power this beast once had.

I grew up with the LASM as THE museum school field trips went to. Their children's discovery area was AMAZING! I'll never forget the pulleys and ropes that you could lift yourself up with...those are gone. I remember the satellite dish-looking echo communication devices being farther apart and even more impressive for it. They're not very far any more. I remember fossil stations that made me feel so smart and accomplished. Those are gone too. The planetarium is still pretty great! They show wonderful videos and documentaries that are very informative! I deeply miss the meaningful and physically visual interactions kids used to get from the full discovery area. Something they get a mere FRACTION of at the new, reduced area.

The family took advantage of the Museum being free the first sunday of each month. So we toured the whole thing and had a blast. My 8 year old couldve enjoyed it all day long. My 4 and 6 year olds really like the space exhibits and seeing the MUMMY in egypt exhibit! They didnt allow pics of the mummy sorry. But this not the only free thing downtown Baton Rouge. In feburary we saw USS Kidd free of charge as well. Next month we might check out old state capital. ( not sure how 4 y.o. will enjoy that one)

Fantastic museum and place to spend an entire day.  Lots of reading on the first floor.  The second floor has a fantastic, big, colorful exhibit on the different cultures and customs of the different regions of Louisiana.  Am anxious to return soon!!!
Went with a 4th grade field trip and it was insightful, organized, and educational...but also fun for the kids AND parents. Great facility and staff.

name: Louisiana State University Rural Life Museum
address: 4560 Essen Ln, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: It is a living history museum.  Tells some of the happy and sad history of Louisiana.  Bring your walking shoes, great way to stretch your legs and learn.

Definitely a place you can spend a good bit of time with so many historical things to see. Spent three hours here & that was just skimming over most things.

Things have been greatly organized and labeled since my last visit in the late '70s. So much has been donated that everyone is bound to find an interest - old farming equipment,  kitchen tools, blacksmithing, old country store, medical instruments,  mourning hair jewelry,  etc.

We happened upon this amazing museum on a recent trip to Baton Rouge. If you are in this area this is a must see place. Many old style buildings and they seem to be true to the time period depicted by the buildings and grounds. I placed four photos on this site. One of the exterior of the Black Smith Shop, and the Hardware store, as well as an interior shot of the Hardware store, and another of a typical home of the era.
Wonderful place to visit! The kids and I both love it. It's fun and very educational. I love their special events, all of which have informational available on the website. Definitely worth the trip!

I was impressed with this indoor and outdoor museum.  It really feels like your walking back in time through a southern community in the 19th century with real buildings that were preserved from that time.  Fyi: the grounds can get wet and mushy.  Worth the trip.

name: Veteran's Memorial Park
address: 599 State Capitol Dr #523, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: What an incredibly beautiful park! While I was there wedding photos were being taken as well as some other photo shoot with models. The trees are old, lush, and large and the flowers are vibrant. I would love to see it in the Summer! Absolutely stunning! A must see! My pictures don't do it justice at all! ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Very nice park to take a walk in. A lot of history and really wonderful to read about the different monuments and buildings. I feel like this is a hidden gem within the city and definitely recommend anyone visiting the city to stop by and enjoy the park.

Nice Park next to the State Capitol. Great place for glamour shots with a cannon. 
Also, a small bit of trivia:
The 1982 movie "The Toy" starring Richard Pryor and Jackie Gleason was filmed in the park. Watch the movie then visit the park to see the sights in the film..
Nice place to take a walk, inside the park and around the lake.

This is a very lovely and well kept park, they had a nice display out for Memorial Day. It would be a great place for a stroll with a date or to enjoy a nice picnic lunch. There was plenty of free parking nearby on a Friday at late morning, and of course the towering Capitol Building dominates the sky and makes for a nice visit to overlook the park from the observation deck.

name: Old Governor's Mansion
address: 502 North Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: The tour was very interesting! The tour guides were friendly and helpful! They even gave us suggestions for places to visit after we left there.

Great venue for a wedding, I mention this due to the separation of the rooms i.e. a cake cutting room, dressing rooms etc. for a wedding. Please bear in mind the space is formally a home/Mansion built many years ago to accommodate LA's governors and their families, so the rooms are separated. The ground floor is not very open. The outside grounds balconies and intricate details in and around the property are beautiful! Gorgeous venue!

We were unable to take the 1 hour tour, but the guide let us look in the first floor rooms. The ballroom has large mirrors at each end with 3 chandeliers in the room. In the middle of the room, looking at either mirror, the chandeliers seem to go on for ever! The guide was a true Southern gentleman, a year younger than the mansion.
The Old Governor's Mansion is a great place to visit for a tour and see very good art and historical exhibits.
This was closed when we arrived but it was cool to see.

name: Blue Bayou Water Park
address: 18142 Perkins Rd E, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: The park is great for adults and kids but nothing is perfect. Let me give the run down....make sure you have $5 cash for parking. Bring a coke can to get $5 off entry fee. It helps. The ground is rough as hell and blazing hot so make sure you have some type of swim shoes or flip flops or socks. Do not bring food or drinks in the park as they will check your bags and make you either throw it away or you can go bring it to your vehicle. They do allow bottles of water but nothing else. Instead of paying their food prices which really weren't too bad at one place...put an ice chest in your trunk and fill it with drinks and sandwiches. The workers were attentive and the water slides are awesome. They have quite a few places for parents to take their little children too which was very nice. There+ is multiple lifeguards at every slide and swimming spot so if your teenager wants to wonder around with their friends...they will be fine. Overall a great trip with the family. If I can think of anything else I'll edit my post. Bring sunscreen!

This waterpark was so much fun. They have awesome water slides, my favorite being the rocket. They also have a lazy River and wave pool which were very fun and relaxing. Best part is you can also access their theme park that is connected to the water park. My daughter and I just loved it. I would recommend getting season passes.

Not much of a crowd today. We were able to find open tables and ride everything without long, long lines. Cement was fiercely hot, so bring water shoes!
Food and drink prices not too bad. It's definitely a dated park. We had seven kids with us, and they had fun.

Kids loved it, but not very pleasant for parents of middle-older kids who want to run around by themselves. I tried enjoying sone shade beneath a cypress tree on  some lovely grass and was told by a lifeguard with a rather nasty attitude that the grass is off limits.  Concrete and plastic furniture only for waiting parents.  Parents have to pay full price whether they slide or not.  For the high cost of admission, it would have been nice to have something to do--a lap pool for example,  or some grass to sit and relax on without getting attitude from young men with power complexes. I should qualify that most of the lifeguards were nice,  and the Pirate's Cove play area is great for whole-family fun.

This place is really fun. Our kids are 12, 10, and 9, and they were able to enjoy all but one of the slides. (One slide has a 95 lb requirement, which our 9 year old didn't meet.)
Lots and lots of shaded tables to enjoy for free. If you want to tan (or roast in the summer), there are plenty of lounging chairs as well. The food options are plentiful and not horribly priced. 
We left the park for lunch and had no trouble getting back into the parking lot ($5) or through the reentry line. There are lots of nice options for food nearby. We went to Zoe's Kitchen, but there was also a Church's Chicken, a burger joint, a marketplace with a deli, a sushi place, and a few other things. 
There's also a Starbucks conveniently nearby for a java jolt on the way home.
You're allowed to bring water bottles into the park, so definitely take advantage of that. There are lots of trees to take shade under, but if you're prone to burning, definitely pack tons of sunscreen (Not the aerosol stuff-it doesn't last in the water. We know cuz we burned.).
Tip: There's a special right now wherein you bring an empty can of a Coca-Cola soda, and you get a $5 discount from your ticket. Take advantage of that!!!

name: Magnolia Mound Plantation
address: 2161 Nicholson Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Take a trip 200 years back in time!  Nice grounds, interesting docents and questions welcomed.   Huge ancient oak trees and outbuildings complete the story of the people who started life on the River,  made themselves rich and their history is still here for us to touch.  Free first Sundays with visiting artists from time to time. A terrific afternoon trip.
The volunteers here go out of their way to make this an exceptional and fun learning place. I love their First Free Sunday tour. Thank you!

I went to Magnolia Mound Plantation with my daughter on a field trip and we had a great time. The outdoor kitchen was my favorite part. It was very informative. I unfortunately could not go into some area because it was too crowded but the places I did get to go were really neat.

We went on First Free Sundays in Baton Rouge. That's when the art and science museums are open free admission. Also the USS KID is awesome to climb around on. It was a destroyer.  Goggle 1st free Sundays in Baton Rouge...it will all pop up.
The grounds are gorgeous and the trees are so cool! The tour was interesting and informative.  My family enjoyed it even though it poured rain!

name: Riverfront Plaza
address: 300 S River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews:
We had a really hard time to find public parking. Finally, we got into the public parking and pay $10 dollar for half day. There is a track on the side of river which is good for quick walk and roam around riverfront. There is historical war museum as well. We could not make it because it was closed for a day. It is good place to snaps  picture  and spend few hours with friends and family. The cool breezes from the river also add adventure of your time. 
You will definitely enjoy your time here.

The plaza has been revamped a lot since I was a child. We watched the sunset around 6:30 and then later that evening walked along the river. We were surprised at how beautiful the sunset was over the Mississippi. The walkway is well lit even at the darkest part of the night. It was pretty clean on the day we went.

It's a nice spot for a picture and view of the river. If you walk the levee during the afternoon or evening it's even better. Just make sure you don't go too late, a lot of shady people around at night.

I love running at the levee on a daily basis prior to hitting the anytime fitness right off of government street ... they have a lot of events down town and this is a great place to take a stroll with family or even alone . It is pet friendly with water fountains equip for our furry friends ...

Excellent view of the Mississippi River. Went there after dinner for a walk with family and loved it. There are bikes available if you want to ride. Surprisingly it was not at all crowded and you could sit peacefully there and appreciate the view. There is a train track parallel to the river. If you are traveling to Baton Rouge, this place is a must visit.

name: Hilltop Arboretum
address: 11855 Highland Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews:
Wonderful and lovely place to stroll as well as to purchase some greenery!

It's not a long stroll, but perfect to take kids on a walk to teach them the names of many varieties of trees, shrubs, and ferns. It's short enough that most children would be interested most of the way through.

It's a beautiful venue for a wedding, too. The space is serene, the pavilion next to the pond is open, and there really would be so much natural beauty! I wish I had scheduled my wedding here, but my guest list was too long to be sure we'd all fit. We wouldn't once it was all days and done. Maybe for another party!
Interesting & peaceful place. Free admission. Very clean. Loads of information about native trees & plants. Majestic & massive trees. Loved our quick stroll through. Gift shop on premises.
Beautiful facility! Loved the peaceful books where you can quietly sit. Public restrooms would be nice however.

Wonderful park, cool in the shade of the hundreds of trees even in full summer. The kids really love rolling down the hill and being able to run freely. Excellent educational and fun experience with several habitats represented and all plants and trees identified. Brought to us by LSU.
It's winter bit still beautiful...can't wait for the spring.

name: Forest Community Park
address: 13900 S Harrells Ferry Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70816, USA
reviews: This is such a cool little park with a splash pad. I say little, but it's quiet large. A lot of places to sit & keep cool.  Good locations for parties & other activities. Tennis spots. Nice restrooms. Really up-to-date park! We will definitely be returning!
Lots of space, a stocked pond and a well maintained dog park. Would love more walking trails through the woods.

Ammending my review from 5 stars to 3 as there is now a cut-through on one side of the park funneling a lot of traffic through it now.  There are always a lot of cars, travelling much too fast, not heeding pedestrians, kicking up dust from the new unfinished road and making the air smell like exhaust.  The kid side of the park is still fine, but avoid the dog park side if you're a walker; it's dangerous and unpleasant now.

My baby and cousin really love going to this park. A great way for your kids to cool down for the summer for free. You can also have a picnic out there. Because, the park is beautiful. They also got a walking trail too.

Its pretty good walk around the lake, I think it's better walk in mornings time. You can found ducks near the lake so it's nice. If you have children this park has enough space and it is beautiful too. So I can say this is one of my favorites park

name: Perkins Road Community Park
address: 7122 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Great park with tons of activities and great walking paths. They have everything you need for skating or extreme biking. They also have a rockwall and a stocked fishing pond. Further down they have a great river walk and a nice outdoor work out area.

We were so excited about the nice weather yesterday so we headed to the park. We love this park. There's so much to do without feeling like you're on top of each other. You can strength train, walk a trail, run, swing, watch a sport, enjoy the view, explore, skateboard, ride a bike, etc. at this park. It's clean and I feel safe when we go to the Perkins Road Park.
Great place to bring the kids.  The park has a skate area with plenty of space, a play ground, a bike track, lots of grass and tables if you want to picnic or sit and read.
Great family park
Plenty of space. Kids loved it and had other friendly kids to play with. Just hot. Bring water lol

name: Odell S. Williams African-American Museum
address: 538 South Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews:
🦚 Vibrant. 🎨 Hopeful. 🌈 Hidden gem. 🕊️ 
This history museum and folk art installation is located beneath a highway overpass and next to a Baptist Church. 

It was closed when I visited however walking the grounds was a pleasure. I was encouraged to see it as a vibrant and joyful celebration of history and testament of determination. 

I look forward to visiting again when it is open and I do hope more folks will stop in and check it out and support this wonderful art and community project in Baton Rouge. Recommended. ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

See you on the road,
📸 🙋‍♂️@gabrielcraft.me
rest in heavenly power, Ms. Sadie Roberts-Joseph. all of us will mourn your departure and honor your life forever more!

It’s a lovely, quaint place. Very colorful and full of life. The lovely woman who runs the place is very passionate about it. It’s so sad to see that some areas have been Vandalized. It is a beautiful piece of history and run by a woman who deeply loves and cares about her community.
Is there a new contact phone number?
Love this museum even though I never went

name: BREC's Baton Rouge Zoo
address: 3601 Thomas Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70807, USA
reviews: This place is very fun for children and if you like something that will take a few hours. This isn’t a very large zoo so don’t expect all day to walk through. But it is a little fun extra thing to do. The lights at the zoo for Christmas are fun for the little ones and takes about 45 minutes to an hour to walk through the hole thing. Only a mile. The animals during the day are awesome to see and a great variety of small and large animals. The food is your typical hot dog and nachos food. The price to get in is reasonable and I believe it’s free if they are two years and under. I took my now wife on a date here years ago and we had a lot of fun. It’s something different and outdoors for a date. We now took our son here for the Christmas lights and it was fun. He got to see Santa and hang out with family. All around the Zoo here is not New Orleans large but big enough for a couple hours visit.

We really enjoyed our Sunday afternoon here. Its a smaller zoo, but very nice. Everything was clean, staff was great, animals looked well taken care of, and the cheeseburger at the flamingo cafe was delicious. We really enjoyed the Otter Chat. Worth the money. Also noticed they have space for weddings, birthdays etc.

Met expectations. A little out of the way but an easy drive. Free parking. Liked the wide walkways. Great play area and petting zoo. Standard animal displays with lots of birds, no lions or elephants.
Train was out of service but looked like a decent attraction. Will go again. Four stars for meeting expectations and value, does need some investment.
Always love to go here, my 2 yr old always ask me to bring her to the zoo. Relaxing place and great walking exercise as well. We love to watch the peacocks walking near the cafe as we rest.

A great fun and relaxing place for all ages in which you get to see many different types of Animals and species. I loved seeing the animals and it allowed me to relax and be calm. The zoo is a must see in Baton Rouge and my favorite part was seeing the tiger at the zoo and taking a picture of it.

name: North Sherwood Forest Community Park
address: 3140 N Sherwood Forest Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70814, USA
reviews: My family have been residents of the area for more than 25 years. I have seen this area go from United States Air Force Depot 2 a FEMA trash collection site to the facility that it is now. The Reformation of it over the last few years has been beautiful. Today my youngest grandson and I enjoyed 4 hours at the facility. We only played on the playground equipment, the bike path, and did a little fishing. We did not utilize any of the Interior facilities, but we had a great time. I think it's great that b r e c has provided an area like this for this community. Thank you. Please don't dump all the trash next door anymore. I'm sure we can find another site to do that. Thank you again!

First and foremost, for those of you who are parents there is a decent inside area for children to play as well as a nice outside. This is a very calm park. I love that there is not a lot of calamity going on around me as I walk or jog around. The one thing I love about this park is that the sidewalk goes completely around surrounded by a lake that you can fish in if you'd like. However, the only issue I have with this park is that there are days that there are so many ducks. The issue is not with the ducks themselves, but the tiny splotches of dung that they leave behind along the parkway. Luckily, the establishment itself is pretty good at clearing that off along with the rain of course. There is an inside track that I also utilize and love. The only issue with the inside track is that it is definitely not designed for a lot of people. It is free to use, but there are only three lanes for walking one of which is a single lane that is used for running. Like I said before the perks of this is that there aren't that many people. It's neat in there and relatively clean (for the most part.) For the price of free--I would say you can't beat it. By-the-by, there is a inside gym but in order to use it you must have a $15 membership monthly.

Great hidden gem in Baton Rouge for birthday parties. Only thing is, I think with rental of a birthday room, the indoor playground should be open as well. As is the indoor playground is only open and open to public certain hours during the week and only open on Saturday on the weekend. We had a party on Sunday last year and it was great but the indoor playground being locked was a big tease to the kids. Hope they change this rule in the future... even if it cost a little more when you rent a room, I believe it would be worth it.

Beautiful park with a duck pond, play areas for little ones and older kids. Well maintained like all other brec facilities. Walking loop is a bonus for adults taking the kids to the park. Indoor facilities were looking good as well.

Love love love this Recreation center and the park is amazing,no one should have any complaints,its in a great location and has something for the young and the young at heart, great use of our tax dollars!

name: LSU Museum of Art
address: 100 Lafayette St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Looks really great! The photos by Children are thought provoking.  Nice downtown location. A group of children on a field trip were fascinated by the quirky schedule of the water sprouts.

Some very interesting exhibits in a beautiful location with awesome point of view on the Mississippi River. A boutique on the first floor with artifacts reproduction and a restaurant on the 6th floor rooftop. Really worth the visit!
Also, next door you can visit the Old Louisiana State Capitol with its spiral staircase and its stained glass dome (see photos), worth a look! Didn't have time for a full visit :-(
We just happened to come on a day they had an event and really enjoyed the conversation and wine. It was very enjoyable!

Lovely museum in miniature. Think of it as a 1/2 & 1/2 museum.   The portrait gallery and Asian art are truly masterful whilst the other 1/2 feels out of place, i.e.,  spiritistic "art."  There  are only 2 pieces of local furniture with rich history which left us looking for more.  Beautiful views of the mighty Mississippi from the expansive windows up there!

Excellent art museum in the heart of downtown Baton Rouge.  Has displays of cultural signifigant art by Louisiana artists as well a prices from around the world. The bottom floor has the student gallery, show casing the student's work, which was my favorite part. Free to students and faculty of the LSU system too.

name: LSU Museum of Natural Science
address: Murphy J. Foster Hall, 119 Dalrymple Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: A very small but diverse museum located on the LSU campus. It focused mostly on animals but there was a small section devoted to rocks and fossils. The animal collection was extensive from giant polar bears to a large bird collection. My favorite was the insect collection at the entrance.
You can see several extinct species in this nice bird collection.
Pretty cool for a small museum to check out when you gotta kill time and it's free!

Visited it whilst in the state for a wedding. The variety of exhibits is interesting and educational, but I feel that having 80% of the huge, boasted collection be a single insect display is cheating slightly. The staff were friendly and helpful but were hesitant to share the visitors WiFi access, which made hiring an Uber home slightly difficult.

Fantastic displays of birds, reptiles and insects. 
A lot to see in such an intimate space.  
Mike the Tiger is also on display

name: Liberty Lagoon
address: 111 Lobdell Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: Normally, this is a great place to visit because it has enough slides to keep older kids occupied for the most part, good area for small children, and the park is small enough to see everything if you make a 360° turn. The bad part about this park is they've started limiting how many people enter at one time. This means you'll regularly see a line as long as a football field waiting to enter the park. Today we waited over an hour to get into the park only to be ejected from the water because of lightning. The lightning part I understand, the hour long wait, I can't. It doesn't take near that long to get into Blue Bayou and there are tons of people there. We've been going to Liberty Lagoon since the year it opened, and we've never had to wait like this before. From speaking to others in line, apparently, the long wait has become the norm. Small children were crying, understandably, up and down the line. One woman fainted in the heat and had to be taken to the hospital by ambulance. We were able to get a free pass to return to the park, however, the day was ruined. LL really needs to do something to get the lines under control.
Kids had a blast....great environment!! Pools probably could use more chlorine....lol other than that, GREAT PLACE!!!

It was amazing all of the kids loved it. There prices are wonderful. Plus there good food. I will definitely go again. One more thing if you are looking for a cheap but fun place go there it will be way better than blue bayou
Nice friendly family place.  Very inexpensive
The lifeguards are always very attentive and the toddler area has more than enough to keep them entertained! My 3 year old had a blast today!

name: Botanic Gardens
address: 7950 Independence Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: A little out of town, but worth the drive.  Very relaxing place with the gardens. Many different types of plants & trees. Paved or semi-paved walkways.
Great place to relax and enjoy.  My wife enjoyed it too.
Pretty little gardens connected to the library.
Good for the mind and the body. Very beautiful.
Lovely facility and landscape. What a joy to have in Baton Rouge

name: West Baton Rouge Museum
address: 845 N Jefferson Ave, Port Allen, LA 70767, USA
reviews: The perfect place for taking photos of any kind. We were there for prom but it would make a lovely place for family photos as well.
Great festival here. The museum has some parts to it that are very interesting. Blues section in the back and a sugar mill scaled to size in the front.

I love this place, and the stuff very great about the 
Guided Tour.its very awesome!!!
If you don’t want there before, you must be go at least once!!!
Can't find a better quality museum with top-notch community activities. Love their French language initiative and their professional and upbeat staff and volunteers

Went with my daughter's 1st grade class here. I had been here years ago, hadn't been back in some time. They've added a lot new exhibits, etc. It's very clean, lots of great information about the town of Port Allen. The staff was great in engaging the children and keeping their attention. Sampling the sugar was exciting and taught the kids about the different types of sugars grown here. I'll definitely go back.

name: Pentagon Barracks Museum
address: 702 River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Very interesting part of our history.
Lots of history here.  Its right across from the State Capitol.  Previous location of LSU!
A hidden gem near the Lousiana State Capitol.  Lots of history.
Great, historic place to visit.
A historic location near the State Capital of Louisiana where Louisiana State University first held classes.

name: North Boulevard Town Square
address: 222 North Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Baton Rouge is doing a great job by constructing the boulevard. A great place to walk with family. At one side you will find tje old capitol, simply beautiful.

This was the second year I went to the Festival of Lights downtown and overall it is an enjoyable experience for the whole family.  There is a snow hill for "sledding," a band stage, vendor's village, and the Coca-Cola truck is there.  

At six o'clock the mayor is supposed to light the square's Christmas tree, but they seem to run late every year by about twenty minutes. 

Immediately following the tree lighting, there is an excellent fireworks show that lasts for a lot longer than expected. 

The festivities start at four pm and end at nine pm.  There is a fun run earlier in the day.

Beautiful place.  Small, clean and just feels good.   Music is piped in and there are tables and chairs under the ancient oaks.  Lovely place to have lunch; even prettier in the quiet of the afternoon/evening.
Great public space. Lots of festivals here.
This was a very relaxing experience as this certain church happen to be putting on an event at my partner's and I's time of arrival!

name: Highland Road Park Observatory
address: 13800 Highland Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: Went there on a field trip. There is one Scientist, who is great with kids and explains astronomy in a fun way. The rest of them have very little patience with children.

This wonderful facility is located directly off of Highland Road. It is complemented with a staff a very knowledgeable people who are enthusiastic in the field. They tend to host a wide array of events open to the public. Perfect spot for all ages.

Really Great Place for families and even small children. I went with my daughter, her fiancee and her 6 yr old twins to see the Super Blood Wolf Moon lunar eclipse last night. They had activists for the children as well as large telescopes set up for viewing.  They are very informative about any questions you have. To my surprise there were people out with chairs and even blankets and sleeping bags on the ground to watch this event. I would definitely recommend this place. There was ample free  parking and fresh hot free coffee.  I did purchase a map of the moon for $7.95 and also a Baton Rouge star guide for $17.95 for the children.  I'm so glad we got to go to this event!!!
Knowledgeable attendants. Plenty of telescopes to look through.  Nice family atmosphere.
Fun place. B.                                         B....,...........bla

name: Repentance Park
address: 275 S River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Cool spot. The USS Kidd is located here and a neat back drop for the park. There is a nice path to walk along the water, neat art and a great fountain. There is small grass areas to play catch and lounge.  It's pretty unique how they have a staircase that goes right down into the water all along the waterfront. My family really enjoyed area.

This is had slowly become my favorite part of downtown baton rouge! Its nice for going on walks. It always nice to go see the Mississippi river and just sit there and people watch, read a book or listen to music. Some people fish, work out, have picnics and enjoy family friendly time.
I was doing work across the street from this building, but I decided to go into the old State Capitol when I was done and it was just as beautiful as ever
Cool spot to watch the river and the sunset.
Live after 5 is the best experience

name: Raising Cane's Dog Park
address: 1442 City Park Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: They are expanding the park right now.  I like this dog park.  It's a nice size and the people I've met there are very friendly.  They have 2 sets of double gates foot entree as well as a water fountain for you and your fur baby. I can't wait to see what they are adding with the renovations.
Nice field for running dogs and water for cooling them off. It would be nicer if BREC set up some agility courses or other fun equipment for the dogs.

Nice dog park, but small. Dogs are almost always friendly. They've got a small dog pool that always seems to have a hole in it. Dogs are almost always friendly. No lights, and they close at dark, which is very limiting in the winter. Small parking lot nearby. Lots of trash cans & waste bags.

I have a very energetic puppy and it is hard to find a place with other puppies who actually want to play! This place has them! I was so excited to see him letting out some energy with his fellow furry (new) friends. Will return!
Enjoyed this hideaway park. Spacious, clean with lots for kids to do to burn up energy 👍🏼

name: City-Brooks Community Park
address: 1515 Dalrymple Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: This park is very well kept. I've never seen any trash,  the play equipment is well maintained, and the wood chips are raked every time I come with the kids. They're are plenty of benches,  a bathroom,  and water fountains.  Attached I'd a dog park that i live bringing my dog to. There is also plenty of grassy places to lay out on a beautiful day. The LSU lakes are close by if you want to take a walk,  ride a bike,  or feed the ducks.
Great free fun for the kiddos !!! Feed the ducks and then walk around to the park and let the kids run out all the energy they can. Lots of fun on a sunny cool day!!!
I enjoy looking out at the water, and watching the ducks play and fight.
Love it... Great place for kids of all ages. Can't wait to go in the Spring and Summer. Educational AND fun!!!

I like this park, I hope more people come to this park, because more people means more fun for kids, and Sometimes we just need a break and sit down to breathe air and relax with nature, so this is the perfect place more nature and life, and less PHONES 👍😉

name: Hollywood Casino Baton Rouge
address: 1717 River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Fun and entertaining place to let it roll. Too bad the fellow at $5 table acted as if it was a $100 table. If betting your rent money I'd suggest going other places, but if want to have good time then let it rip. The dealers were fun and professional. Enjoy your time at Hollywood!

Great buffet. Lots to choose from. My favorite was the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and the stuffed bell peppers with shrimp.  We really enjoyed eating here. The view was great. Right on the river. You can see the baton rouge bridge. The customer service was amazing in comparison to laberge casino. The atmosphere was Quant and everything was very clean.

We went to the buffet on Christmas Day when we didn't feel like cooking, and were pleased to find consistently good food. The hours have been reduced since we visited before, and we generously tipped the waitress who brought our drinks and extra silverware and plates as she was working on Christmas Day so we could eat out. My only negative finding has been the same for years. The desserts are pretty but don't have much flavor.
Feeling great time for myself and friends to bring for sharing good times.
It was okay.   We didn’t win anything but it was nice.  You well we had to buy our drinks.   I always have a good time when I’m out with Jeffery so... check it out

name: Independence Community Park
address: 7500 Independence Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: Clean, beautiful, and well-maintained park. Must go for a peaceful time.

The grass surrounding the soccer fields is poorly maintained, and the bathrooms near them are in disrepair. There is a downed tree touching the edge of the field closest to the library as well. However, there is adequate parking and a well shaded bench to sit at near the library. Overall, I prefer Burbank, but it's okay.

This park has come a long way in its many years. Now sporting a nice soccer complex, probably the nicest library in Baton Rouge, a beautiful botanical garden, a park for children, a summer water park for all ages and a state police station that makes everything feel very safe. Definitely worth a visit and a place to relax and kick back on a day off if toy want to get out the house.

If you are the type to actually read reviews on community parks, this is the one you’re looking for. Plenty of room to run, playground equipment, restrooms, covered picnic tables, and soccer fields. Plus, it’s an uncrowned area so you won’t lose the kids in a mass of children. Great park!

Probably one of the better kept BREC facilities. The pond is stocked and well kept around the perimeter. All the rest of the facilities are clean and well kept. Everything here is basically the best of the best you can possibly expect from our local Baton Rouge facilities.

name: Waddill Wildlife Refuge
address: 4142 N Flannery Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70814, USA
reviews: This is an awesome secret in the BREC Park system. Love the fishing lakes that are stocked with plenty of fish. Great place to take kids. I go for the Air Rifle Range to target shoot. The free price is awesome. The place is clean and well managed.

My dad and I had a nice time. The two pond areas are very neat and clean with benches around them. Saw several people catching bass and catfish. I caught one little bass myself about 8 inches long right before we left.
There is limited shade between 3-5pm. It would have been nice to know which pond held which type of fish at the sign in post. Bass are in the first one BTW and catfish in the other. They have public restrooms that are supplied and clean. And cane poles that can be borrowed. Overall really nice nice fishing spot we plan to check out again with some different bait!
The facility is great. Very clean. Fishing is very slow
It is some big fish over there
Good trails for hiking and bird watching.

name: Milford Wampold Memorial Park
address: 901 Stanford Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Went today with my dog. Did the whole 4 plus mile walk around the big lake.  Enjoyed it very much.  Beautiful ducks, docks, benches.  Bikes for rent as well.  Walk through the Greek area of college town.

The park is always clean with lovely views. There are benches, a dock, and launch for kayaks and paddle boards. There's often fun events here such as the sunset paddle. It can be a little bit busy at times since it's a very popular park, but it's really quite lovely.

The park borders LSU lakes and provides easy access to running / walking paths. There are fitness stations and filtered water foundations located on site in addition to picnic tables and a restroom facility. The restroom almost always needs attention - it rarely has soap & toilet paper and the toilet is often filthy. Parking is limited which results in the lot being fully occupied during peak fitness times and seasons. I suggest arriving early and carpooling if you're visiting with a group.
Very beautiful and serene park. Love it!
Very nice for running or walking. Gets breezy and the temperature is usually a bit lower than further away from the lake. Helps to cool down during the hot days. View is really soothing.

name: Highland Road Community Park
address: 14024 Highland Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: What an amazing place! The disc golf course offers something for every skill level. A little light for people who have 450' on demand but still challenging and most importantly fun. Bathrooms and pet friendly are a HUGE bonus. Baton rouge should be proud of this place.

My favorite park in the world! I grew up going here and playing softball here and now to be able to take my own kids, it is just beautiful. My kids love walking around, riding their bikes and scooters and having picnics here. The view alone is breath-taking and peaceful.

Was a beautiful park but the address for this location needs to be different from the center around the corner. I went to a baby shower at the center around the corner and when I gps the address it took me to the park not the building where the party was but the center had the same address. I think that should be done better. Someone was kind enough to show us where the place was but overall I enjoyed the shower.
Peaceful, stillness, love of the beauty of GOD'S wonder!!!!. A time to think of our connection to his creation.

Nice, clean community park.  Concrete sidewalk for walking/jogging.  Nice open areas for lounging and enjoying nature.  Disc golf course for the stoners.  And a nice pavilion and splash pad for kids/birthdays/parties.

name: Greenwood Community Park
address: 13350 LA-19, Baker, LA 70714, USA
reviews: I play the disc golf course here. It's a fantastic little technical course and not really as populated as most others so its quiet and relaxing. But overall the whole park is maintained and just generally what you expect out of park. I've been coming here for years and it is definitely an underrated park for all that it offers and it is right behind the Baton Rouge Zoo so you can make a day out of just one area. 5 stars, highly recommended.
Really nice and clean park. Great place to take the kids.
Beautiful park!  I love that you can rent canoes and kayaks. Great playground.
First visit.  Beautiful day for it.  Loved walking the trail around the lake.
Great safe place for family reunion exercising fishing picnicking or just relaxing in the sun

name: Spanish Town Historic District
address: Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Cute houses. I didn't really see many shops though
Best parade in southern Louisiana.
Really nice area. Good examples of Old Louisiana style in buildings and housing
The oldest neighborhood in Baton Rouge. Great place to walk and home to some unique architecture, especially bungalows. Several historic houses if you keep an eye out for the plaques.
Best neighborhood in Baton Rouge, friendly neighbors, and eclectic lifestyles. It's where I live so might be biased.

name: LSU AgCenter Botanic Gardens
address: 4560 Essen Ln, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: Wonderful place, perfect for hiking, spending the afternoon, doing photo shoots and even having a wedding!  I am planning my wedding and was very well attended by the wonderful Katie Guitreau.  Loved this place!

The Annual plant sale was fantastic with a huge variety of not only the super Plants but also a large variety of plants being studied for their ability to survive the local elements.  This event was very well planned out and very well organized.  All the Master Gardner’s were very knowledgeable as well as helpful.  This location has lots to offer and even rents out their facilities for Weddings etc.

Great place to take a walk and enjoy the beautiful flowers and trees! Many others plants as well! They have about 4-5 different trails and have a map to show you the way around the property! Lots of signs that provided great information about the area and the plants. The gardens are beautiful and vast in the front. And it’s free which is great!
This is a great place on a day you have nothing else to do but stroll and get lost hiking around. You’ll pass along tangerine trees where you can stop and have a treat. Really cool.

Beautiful, peaceful grounds; well-maintained gardens; rustic tree based playground equipment and modern pollinator garden playground equipment for kids; nice easy to navigate hiking trails; helpful and well-informed staff.

name: St. Joseph Cathedral
address: 401 Main Street, Postal: 412 North Street, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: This historic cathedral features German-designed stained glass and a magnificent crucifix which must be seen in person to truly appreciate!
I didn’t particularly care having the cross off center.  The cathedra is in the center of the sanctuary.  Who is supposed to be the center of our worship?
Visited Cathedral Square during the Saturday Main Street Market which was all about healthy and delicious and it was Fabulous!!!   4 Stars because Indidnt actually visit the inside of the cathedral.
I'm a parishioner there.  Great sermons
It was a great mass . I am from Borger Texas and I have gone to mass there several times and I have always felt welcome.  Great place to meet for mass

name: Burden Museum & Gardens
address: 4560 Essen Ln, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: I have lived in NOLA for many years, but I had never visited here. I must say, that was a huge mistake. The park is beautiful. There is plenty parking, great scenery, and a huge plot if land to set up for picnics and gatherings. What I found most spectacular was the accessible and relatively clean restrooms. I am quite picky about using the toilet outside and in public places. This restroom was pretty decent and did not smell like a urinal.

I had a wonderful time for my first visit to the garden.  We enjoyed the hayride. Got the opportunity to pick my first orange off a tree. 
The pet animals was nice and the food was delicious. Hamburger's and corndogs was a hit. So was the corn on the cob.
I forgot to mention the Corn Maze. That was fun too!!!!!
I took my small group os adults with special needs. We all had a lot of fun. The tour guide was great and kept every excited about the things we were seeing.
So much to see at this museum! Wish we had come with more time. A lot to see indoors and outdoors. Very educational.
It's absolutely beautiful place. It's very well kept it always has great holiday events for families to come enjoy and fun.

name: Mississippi River Park
address: 299 River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Water. A safe paved path to walk, bike, jog, or stroll. Steps, benches and cool Red Beach chairs to sit closer to the Mighty Missisip!  Great venue to watch bands and parades. Relaxation at its best downtown. Enjoy your visit(s). Oh, education and photo ops are plentiful. Ciao!

It is so wonderful to see the mirror sculpture, the American Duchess Cruise Ship floating and docked, walking/jogging trails,  bikers, skate boarding, visitors and citizens congregating on the River Front enjoying the  Mississippi River view. Great place to get your exercise on and it is free. The sunset is gorgeous and a must see. BR Proud!
Beautiful place to run/walk/bike, very flat and with a view

Wheelchair accessible "trailhead" to the Mississippi River Levee Path and Levee Loop (1.5 miles). Water fountain, power outlets, wheelchair ramp, few chairs, stunning view.   Walking on top of the levee offers great views and provides a perspective when the Mississippi is at flood stage and higher than downtown Baton Rouge. Anglers, joggers, walkers, photo shoots, I even saw two young women practicing pole dancing moves on the plentiful lanterns.
It's a beautiful scenic place to watch the sunset on the river as you watch the river boats and barges pass by. It's also a great spot to get a run in.

name: Baton Rouge City Park
address: 1515 Dalrymple Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Excellent! Family and fitness oriented!
Perfect place to bring my little kids
Quiet park bring bread for the ducks and geese+
Great park. Excellent playground for the kids. Lots of tree cover for shade.  Plenty of bemches and picnic tables. Very well kept grounds. Nice dog park. We were very impressed.
A very quiet Serene place to sit and have breakfast.

name: Louisiana Department of Wildlife and Fisheries
address: 2000 Quail Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: As an animal health professional, I agree that the speckled trout population is on the decline and much of it is due to the Corps of Eng's. Most of the eggs from juvenile trout in the Biloxi Marsh will die in the fresh water from yearly Spillway openings. Eggs from the trout over 20" in Breton Sound will more likely to survive in higher salinity. A slot limit worked for redfish and makes more sense for specks.

Very quick in an out.  Nothing worse than spending the day at the government offices. 
Was very helpful...
Excellent service and we walked in and was called to the window right away
Great customer service. If only the drivers license office was this nice and polite and efficient.

Pretty nice place it's set back to make it look like it is in the woods. The staff are welcoming as you come in and direct you quickly. We came to get our boat registered and were in and out within 20 minutes. We were able to pick up booklettes about fishing, boating laws and even maps of the area. The staff member that helped us was awsome and answered all our questions with a big smile.

name: Gus Young Park
address: 4200 Gus Young Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Well kept park. Area didn't feel safe. Not an are where I would take my family.
They need to put the swimming pool back
Very quiet park in a weekday morning. Well-maintained playground, and a quiet place to park and talk on the phone or make a grocery list.
Fun

Needs the restoration that has been applied to other BREC parks in the city. The wood chips are dangerous and uncomfortable for the small children and people in sandals. But my toddler enjoyed herself

name: BREC Recreation & Park
address: 3140 N Sherwood Forest Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70814, USA
reviews: Great facilities except for the fishing. Everybody he's a big lake but when you cast out it's only if you feed beef all the way across. I know they probably want to prevent drowning but it also prevents the fish life for such an expensive fishing facility.

The place is awesome!  Love the ducks outside.  Very popular place for sure.  Lots to do for all ages!  Everyone I met while there was cool except for one guy that worked in the gym that musta thought I wasn’t paying so instead of just looking up my name AFTER I signed in he asks me if I had a membership.  I told him yes, then he promptly went back to sleep.  I kid you not, I literally never saw the guy lift his head from that desk except to walk outside or start collecting the trash if it was getting close to 8pm.  Not trying to throw shade on the place but he was wrong for that.  If I was working there, a middle aged white dude, and I asked him, a middle aged black guy, the same thing without even checking first, Lord only knows what would happen to me.
Was very quiet, friendly visitors, great place to fish and not crowded at all. Could use more seating near fishing areas for visitors that cannot stand for longer periods.

Beautiful walking trail, larger than some of the other parks. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because I hate that people come out there smoking weed. In broad daylight. No respect for the kids or others. May need someone to patrol the area.

This is a very cool place to go if you just want to be outside or picnic or shoot basketball or do anything that consists of the outdoors it's very clean and a very fun place to be I go there just to relax and breathe in some fresh air and think I'd recommend this place to anyone

name: Independence Park Tennis Facility
address: 7501 Independence Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: A really nice place, and I will bring my family back for another visit
Go to a NA meeting here its great
Great courts, Friendly Staff
This facility is wonderful!
Thrive Church meets here on Sunday, 1030-1200, come check us out

name: Cohn Arboretum
address: 12206 Foster Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70811, USA
reviews: Very nice gardens and vegetables planted. Well maintained and friendly staff.
Beautiful garden with various plants, trees, flowers, fruits, and vegetables growing. There is also an old slave house that can be toured if it's not a holiday. I like to go and walk around.
Beautiful place.. definitely worth checking out.. kids loved it
Well kept up. The people were real polite
Beautiful place to relax and reflect.

name: Frenchtown Rd Conservation Area
address: 17819 Frenchtown Rd, Central, LA 70739, USA
reviews: Always a beautiful experience. The trails are well kept, but not so overly kept that it's not a fun hike. Love exploring.

This was a great trail walk !! I rate 4/5 due to not much “to see” visually for myself. However I enjoyed myself . What I liked most was the trail is “unmarked” on the ground (so it felt like an adventure) its obvious the path and they do have a few tree marks just in case the very light tracking on the ground gets confusing. My first time I only walked the trail, did not visit the “beach”. I will next time.
Pretty good trails. A couple of the smaller ones could use a trimming.
Great place for a family hike through some beautiful nature. My kids loved the bamboo forest the most. They have two trails, we took the shorter one the first time out.
Some of the trails were not maintained but we still had fun exploring!

name: Hooper Road Park
address: 6261 Guynell Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70811, USA
reviews: I really want to like this MTB/hiking trail. The issue is it is not as popular or well maintained as Comite. I arrived at 10am on a Saturday and no one else was there. I had to run with a stick in my hand to knock down the 100s of spider webs crossing the path. It feels more shaded and rooted than Comite up the road. Also more moist. The trail itself is strenuous for runners or bikers. Just dont forget to bring the bug spray.
Nice quiet and relaxing  environment.  I working and take my lunch break there. Fishing and hiking is the name of the game here.
Signs could be more organized but a fun hike regardless
Great play area for kids and trails are nice as well
Lovely outdoor hiking trails.

name: Comite River Park
address: 8900 Hooper Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70818, USA
reviews: We just moved to Louisiana, and were looking for a good park to get the kids out of the house and walk. Perfect park to be outdoors and chasing trails. The kids loved it too (6, and 10).

This is basically the only option around here.  That being said, it’s pretty good.  Nothing crazy technical or anything with big exertion.  No big downhills although that’s to be expected in the South.  Maybe like 3 spots where I gotta drop the seat.  Great flow and a great workout.  Do it twice!

We hiked over comite river park a couple of times last year. Definitely recommend everyone to go! Great for hiking and biking, with various landscapes! Make sure you wear waterproof hiking boots because it may have some water ponds on your way if it has rained a couple days before, which is very common in Louisiana.
Awesome trails for beginners and up. Fun loop

I went here because  there were so many great reviews. We were using Google maps and it brought us to the middle of a neighborhood I’m in Google says park and you have to walk the rest of the way. We see a small fence so we decide to go right under we saw a little trail so we  followed it.  It lead  to a  ditch with trash and a  bike tire.  We decided to keep on going and found a electrical machine thing and in a little trail
  We fall in the trial  and it was just a bunch of trees and bugs it was complete silence then all of a sudden we hear her yell watch out it was a biker. I do not Recommend this trail. It be easier to drive a little bit farther for a good trail.

name: Blackwater Conservation Area
address: 9385 Blackwater Rd, Baker, LA 70714, USA
reviews: The trails are great. Lots of options for length of him. The trails are easily accessible by our small children, but interesting enough for our older kids. We love that large sections are shaded, and you have a mix of docks on the water and trails through the trees. A great, free outing!
Very beautiful place out of the hustle and bustle of the city.

Be careful when visiting.  My wife's wallet was stolen from our bag while we were fishing and our belongings were out of eyesight.  By the time we got back to our car and realized, charges were already made to her credit card. This is a pretty nice place but beware of some of the clientele visiting.
Well maintained trails and plenty of spots around the lakes to fish.
Very nice place, but can't fish in the big lake! It's full of lilies! So limited to where you can fish!!

name: Baton Rouge Sunset Museum
address: Baton Rouge, LA 70820, USA

name: Rivault Park
address: 900 S Jefferson Ave, Port Allen, LA 70767, USA
reviews: Very clean, has covering, and benches. The restrooms are clean. Multiple fields to play on.
Nice for the kids. Nice place for baseball
Just drove through while birding.
Beautiful trees and really nice baseball diamonds
Nice family place. Clean and kids love to be out on field playing ball.

name: Old Bogan Fire Station
address: 427 Laurel St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: A must to go visit! Amazing atmosphere and plenty of amazing history. Can't wait till the renovation is completed!
Looking with bride as wedding venue, fantastic
Awesome
Downtown Baton Rouge gem!

name: River Center
address: 275 S River Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Not a great venue. But, not terrible either. Went here for a conference. The food, selection, facilities, etc. were all perfectly ok. But, not stand out or great.
Great venue for live acts! Right on the mighty Mississippi!
Came to work a booth during hollydays and the power went out. It was out for about 4 hours. Place can get very hot quick but staff made sure the staff were comfortable.
There for a ball. Fantastic place!
Great place for a Concert!

name: Plaquemine Lock State Historic Site
address: 57730 Main St, Plaquemine, LA 70764, USA
reviews: This was such a neat little place tucked away in this small town in southern Louisiana. I was passing through on business and I stopped by and spoke to a very friendly knowledgeable man named Stanley. He took such pride and joy sharing what was special to him and imparted great knowledge about the area. I'm grateful people like this exist who take pride in what they do and are excited to share their passion with others..
Awesome history lesson 30 minutes from Baton Rouge

Great historical place to visit. Learned more than I would have expected. Was shown all of the lock and museum by wonder people that were actually locals and knew the history first hand. Thank you both for a great memorable visit.

Interesting tour of how and when the lock was in operation. Beautiful building in perfect condition. Grounds are lovely and includes a very nice view of the great muddy Mississippi River. It is free and has a small donation box.
I recommend it!

If you're a hardcore enthusiast of Louisiana history, you may enjoy this very niche tidbit of our state's story. The centerpiece of the town's attractions, there are a few things to check out inside the museum regarding the lock's history and how it all worked. You can also walk around outside and across the short bridge spanning the long-defunct lock, which once connected to the Mississippi River.
Beyond that, there's not very much to do outside of simply walking around. Most people in the area come here just for that, and the area is rarely crowded outside of several events occurring nearby throughout the year.
Last time I checked, there's no fee to enter the museum, but call ahead just to be sure.

name: Zachary Community Park
address: 20055 Old Scenic Hwy, Zachary, LA 70791, USA
reviews: It has multiple bathrooms, a little library,  fishing spot and dog park. There is some outdoor exercise equipment  and a nice path to walk/ run on. There is an area where you can do an outdoor birthday. My kids favorite part besides the playground equipment  is the splash pad.
Niece loves this park. Always clean and nice equipment with a pretty good variety. The splash pad is very fun too!
This is a top notch park.  There is a splash pad, the most amazing playground and fishing pond.  The facility is impeccably kept.

Great park! The grounds are clean and there is plenty of space for everyone to play. The splash pad is great, especially since it's been so hot out. There's even a little lending library box on the grounds where you can take a book and leave a book for others absolutely free. There's a dog park as well and work out space. The walking trail is also awesome!

Excellent playground equipment. Super clean and fun. Lots of seating and shade. Skateboard park, basketball court, walking/running paths, dog park, fitness equipment, and a splash pad.  There is no shortage of things to do here or try. Pavilions are available for rental for special occasions. Excellent park!

name: LaHouse Home and Landscape Resource Center
address: 2858 Gourrier Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70820, USA
reviews: Wonderful energy efficient home concept. I went mainly to show raised garden beds to a friend. We decided to do a tour of the LaHouse Home. It is just grand.
Fascinating and necessary research for our environment and comfort

First time I went I thought "this iangoing to be lame," but ut was actually very good. Every year I take a group of highschool students and they have a blast. The people there will arrange interesting educational activities for students to do to break up the tour. Also, some of the stuff I have learnee has helped me ro lower my electric bill.
Awesome place, but make sure to register ahead for classes, because they fill up fast!
A great LSU establishment for parties

name: Jackson Community Park
address: 12250 Sullivan Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70818, USA
reviews: It's not a bad little park, it really isn't, and I also adore the Tiny Steps program here. But be aware that this park is currently undergoing major renovations and has been for several months now. Particularly if it's been rainy, getting into and out of this park can be a challenge in its current state.
The staff at Jackson/brec park is unbelievable.  They are so nice,  helpful,  kind,  and accommodating.

As far as the BREC  facilities go this park this park is a bit on the small side but is equipped with covered park benches for picnics or birthday parties. Has tennis courts and indoor facilities that have a gymnastics set up. At the time I went the front parking lot was still under construction.

Splash Pad is Great!!! Could use a better playground.  No baby swings and the actual playground is more for little kids and not really good for kids 6 and up.  I mean they can play but it does not really seem to be intended for a older kids who actually need a little bit more of a challenge.  Please please please upgrade the playground.  Considering the splash pad is located here, the playground needs to be up to par.
Great environment My children had a lot of fun

name: Burbank Park
address: 12400 Burbank Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews:
The dog park here is amazing. Very large with an attached pond the dogs can swim in and a place outside the gate to hose off. The dog owners enforce behavior and generally I'll tempered dogs leave from the prompting of people there without incident.

Don't forget to pick up after your dog!
There is lots of deals everywhere they are improving the facilities
Great place to play soccer but bring chairs!!
Great open space

My son plays soccer for BRSC.  There are plenty of fields that are in decent shape.  We have visited other fields that are more impressive in quality lately, but not as plentiful.  BRSC has tons of potential though.

name: Sanova Dermatology - Baton Rouge
address: 6411 Perkins Rd #100, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: I saw Donna Vial, PA for a skin check. The check in process was easy and quick, the waiting room comfortable and serene. I was called back promptly and the nurse and PA were both personable and professional. Donna was cheerful, thorough and provided easy to understand explanations about my skin. My appointment took less than 20 minutes and checkout was a breeze.

My experience at Sanova Dermatologist clinic was absolutely amazing! The staff there made me feel comfortable throughout my entire procedure. I would definitely recommend them to anyone. Thank you again Dr. Prather and for your wonderful staff members.

Dr Prather
The care and concern you receive from the entire staff is very comforting. The best I have had.!! They talked me through every step. They are wonderful people.

Dr. Tucker has worked out my issues with me and saw to it that I understood the problem and what to do about it.   She provided me with economical solutions and gave me samples of the meds to get me started before I invested in the prescription. I would not go anywhere else!

The atmosphere is warm and inviting; the staff is just wonderful; Dr Donna Vial is warm and friendly and so thorough and takes time to explain everything! This will be my dermatology clinic from now on! And appointment was right on schedule.. no long waiting

name: Parrain's Seafood Restaurant
address: 3225 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Great down home atmosphere is what's best about this place. Shared raw oysters (that are half price all day on Tuesday) and had great drinks from the bar. Our waiter was great and very attentive even though he had another table of 20!!!! The hostess staff were great and overall it was a good experience. The bar is lively and everyone seemed to be well taken care of. My only gripe is concerning presentation. The raw oysters do not come on ice. I've come to expect it and I am convinced it serves a purpose. Other than that small nuance (mine only), it was a great place that I'll be returning to soon.

The food is good at best, and that's mainly because you don't have to go through the effort of frying it all up yourself. You barely get any food for what you pay, the whole shebang platter which costs around $24, resembles more of a plate lunch I would get from my local church, and those usually taste better. Everyone has an opinion and this is mine, better places for seafood easily.

A wonderful dining experience. Service was excellent, food was wonderful. My daughter had the vermilion nice size portion, excellent flavor. I had the drum which was the dinner special it was amazing, my husband had the seafood platter.  It was also a very large portion and tasted absolutely delicious. Will definitely be going back. A little pricey but worth it!

The food was good, but not as good as I remember it from my 1st visit several years ago.
What I am missing is the "fresh, vibrant, original," taste of ingredients.
The food is good and rich but also lame because the main flavors don't shine in the dishes.

What I ate:
* Charbroiled oysters. Sadly oysters were overpowered by strong cheese flavor. 
* Seafood gumbo - Please serve the rice on the side. It hides all the other ingredients that should be there, though some small mushy shrimps were discovered eventually.
* White cholate bread pudding - the sauce is the best part here!  Presentation of the dessert is well done. However, I recommend serving the sauce with bread pudding dipping chunks instead. It would be an awesome taste sensation that way.

What a pleasant surprise! This was my first time to visit, and boy I'm glad I did. I'll definitely come again. Seating was fast. I really enjoyed the decor, particularly the colorful painting of the bayou. Our waiter was excellent. Pleasant, knowlegable, and attentive...not too attentive. Food was excellent. I had the chicken platter. Well prepared and cooked.

name: Louisiana Lagniappe Restaurant
address: 9990 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: I eat here every time I'm in Baton Rouge because I love it so much. It's a little pricey, but definitely worth it! Listen carefully to the specials and try to select one of them. The bread is awesome and the house salad makes me want to lick the plate. Don't miss this place, you'll thank me

I THOROUGHLY ENJOYED THE CHICKEN ACADIAN. The seafood gumbo and stuffed mushroom for appetizers were great, too.

The 🍓 strawberry cheesecake was a tasty dessert. Do not order the pecan pie unless you like your pecan pies heavily piled with pecans and...tasteless.

I came in for Valentines day with my girlfriend and had a delightful dinner. Our server Austin was quite pleasant and knowledgeable about the menu. We took his reccomendations, which were all incredible. Honestly this was one of the best meals I've ever had. I'll definitely be back!

There is not a single negative to say about this restaurant. Maybe it was a little loud? But you know what that was? People happily talking and not a single phone out anywhere. People were enjoying great food and each other's company and an overall wonderful dining experience. The a la roland was perfect, and I ate every bite of my salad, which I rarely do. Our server was the best. Thank you for an awesome dining experience.

The food was rich and tasty but it left me thinking how much I'd have to work out for the next week to burn off the calories. I hoped to find something a little lighter but gave in and went with a  fried fish entree. The servers were very attentive and friendly.

name: Ruth's Chris Steak House
address: 4836 Constitution Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews:
Our first visit to Ruth’s Chris Baton Rouge was nothing less than stellar.  Our server Christine was 5-star herself.  She was friendly, knowledgeable, helpful, and had a great personality. She really helped make our evening extra special.
