The food was exactly what we expected from Ruth’s Chris.....Amazing!  The manager Brent was extremely friendly, professional, and courteous.  We will definitely return to indulge in 5-star service, ambiance, and of course, the food.

This Ruth's Chris was the best one I went to. Everything from the Calamari to the cut of steak was amazing and perfect in flavor. (Highly recommend the Calamari) Our server Vincent was very nice and very sweet. He honestly brought this experience up and made it even better. I will definitely come here again and bring my friends when I go to College.

Great take out experience, service was delightful and since I ate at home I was able to go caveman on that awesome bone in ribeye. The food was too good to eat on plastic so I plated it and lit a candle.

Service was excellent as always. The food was to die for. The T-bone was melt in your mouth tender, and seasons to perfection. The lobster tail was amazing as well, served with candle lit warm butter. They even through in a birthday cheesecake for my wife. The drinks were nice and refreshing 👌 . Would give ten stars if the chart went that high. I've eaten at Ruth's Chris steakhouses all over the country but this is the best one by far. Thumbs up to the chef too!

I used to enjoy this restaurant, however I will never return. This publicly-traded company took $20 MILLION from the Paycheck Protection Program, (with help of Chase Bank) beating out small businesses in our city that need funding. I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE! SHAME ON YOU!! Hopefully, you will be forced to close permanently and will be denied Bankruptcy protection.

name: Stroubes Seafood and Steaks
address: 107 3rd St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: When I go out to eat not only do I look for great food and a great atmosphere but I also look for great service and Stroubes has just that. I went in and ate at the bar and was greeted by the bartender Layla right away. I just ordered a water and asked her for her recommendations because it was my first time there. I ended up getting the Pork Porterhouse. The food came out fast, hot, fresh, and delicious. My water never at one time was empty and once I was completed with my entree I was immediately offered dessert. I took Layla's recommendation and went with the bread pudding which was phenomenal. I highly recommend if you're sitting at the bar Layla is an amazing bartender and if you're sitting in the restaurant Sidney is one of the best servers! Overall I had an amazing experience and I will definitely return!

We have just had the best meal EVER at Stroubes Seafood and Steaks. The martinis 🍸 were delicious and the filet Oscar was superb!!! Dessert white Chocolate Praline pudding out of this world! Waiter extremely attentive and courteous. So worth it! If you are looking for a dining experience that will cap off a great Baton Rouge vacation this is it! A must stop for fine dining.
LOVE,LOVE,LOVE THIS PLACE. GREAT FOOD. AWESOME ATMOSPHERE. AND WHERE ME AND MY WIFE ATE AFTER I PROPOSED.

The place was nice, and had good reviews, so I thought I'd try their 1942 sandwich recipe, for a change. As I entered for lunch, the place was mostly empty. Seeing that there were more than 9 empty tables next to windows, I asked the girl at the front desk if I could sit at one of them. She went to check (what, I don't know, there were multiple available...) and ended up sitting me in the middle of the restaurant, like 10 feet away from any window. Maybe she didn't hear me correctly, but I didn't want to be pushy, so I let it go - but this didn't set me up for a great experience at this place. I saw no less than 4 waiters and waitresses walking around (doing what, who knows, because every single table was set already). Instead of them, the woman at the bar took care of my lunch. This was the only person in the restaurant who seemed to be working, with me and two other gentlemen sitting at the bar. Notice that she was working at the bar, yet getting my order at a booth - while the other 5 people were doing... what exactly? Now, this lady from the bar was absolutely delightful. She took my order, made sure I had water a couple times, and brought me my check when I was done, all while having the most wonderful attitude that, frankly, made my meal. The 1942 sandwich was what I expected - different, a sign of simpler, more basic times, tasty without blowing you away. Then again it's $8 plus tax, but maybe instead of throwing a giant amount of fries, this restaurant could consider giving about 2/3 the fries and adding something like a pickle to spice things up. Other than that, it was a decent sandwich. Only my confusion at the rest of the staff lowered my impression of Stroubes a bit, but the lady at the bar that took care of my lunch, she made the day. Give her a raise.

Food is high quality.  Some materials management issues. I have been here several times in the past 4 months. 2 times in the last month I ordered a Manhattan and they were out of vermouth. And no, not the next day, visits separated by several weeks. And for a seafood and steak place that only has 3 steaks on the menu, you can't run out of rib eye at 730 on a Saturday night. But 4 stars,  the food is good.

name: Texas de Brazil
address: 10155 Perkins Rd Ste 100, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: Fun night. Some of the cuts had a little more gristle than on previous occasions, but for the most part they did not. Not a good value for kids, but for adults who love meat, it's the best in town. The salad bar is even pretty good. The pickled spicy shrimp were my least favorite. One adult, and six kids was right over $350.00 with no alcohol.

Texas de Brazil never fails to be amazing! The food was perfect. We went for our anniversary with a coupon for dessert, and they even made a little note on it for us. Very kind of them to celebrate with us

This place is awesome! Many different selections of meat that are brought out to you along with a great selection of wines and desserts. Also, there's a salad bar with everything you can think of. My husband and I have been there multiple times. Trust me you'll love it.

Best restaurant I have ever been to in my life. The atmosphere was beautiful and elegant but yet casual enough that people were having great conversation and laughing and having a great time. Everything was so well taken care of and so clean. Beautiful decor and very spacious room and very much space. Beautiful dining tables and settings. The food was absolutely amazing. I have never had anything so good in my entire life! Everything was cooked to perfection. The right combination of cheeses from the salad bar along with the different types of meat was so amazing! The waiter and the rest of the staff were so professional and courteous and generous with every part of our dinner. We had an amazing experience and I would recommend to everyone to go there and experience for yourself.

This restaurant is the one I like best. I eat in a lot of restaurants but to this one I  constantly return again and again. The stuff is very warm and the cuisine they place on your table is so good. I am always happy to have a good meal here. Highly recommended.

name: Cocha
address: 445 N 6th St, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Cocha has superb, high quality, fresh, locally-sourced menu items that are sure to please your palate! There are plenty of dishes suitable for herbivores AND carnivores! Cocha has an excellent lunch menu that hits that sweet spot. What I mean by this is - you won't go back to the office overly-stuffed; rather, you leave this establishment pleasantly full and euphoric! The atmosphere is great... something you'd see in a much bigger, more cosmopolitan city than Baton Rouge. You definitely owe it to yourself to try Cocha. I suspect it will quickly land within your top few favorite local restaurants! It's definitely a great restaurant for going on a romantic date!

Love this place! Very attentive service, amazing cocktails, great ambience and usually has one or two veg friendly dishes though this is definitely an omnivore's place. They now have outdoor seating as well. Upscale but with a neighborhood feel: they aren't pretentious.

Superb dining with a nice atmosphere. Waiter was great. Service at a nice pace, not rushed but not waiting forever either. 

Have eaten here about 4 times over several years when in town on a business trip and never have I been disappointed. 

Specialty cocktails also great, odd combinations that work well together. Pricing is very reasonable compared to the quality of the food. Highly recommend this place for a good dining expetience.

The menu while not extensive features a good variety of dishes, about a dozen main ones they can concentrate on to make excellent. Daily specialties also. Menu changes quarterly with the seasons.

The food was very good. The Garden Focaccia bread was great. The bread was lightly toasted, and the balsamic dip provided an exquisite flavor complement. The Garden Fettuccine was good, and the natural blending of the tomatoes and asparagus gave an extra depth of flavor. The salmon that I ordered was cooked to my request and flaked very well. I definitely recommend this restaurant.

I had high hopes for this restaurant because it has such excellent reviews, but I was a bit disappointed. First, they gave us menus and when it was time to order the waiter said they just changed the menus and didn’t have what we wanted. So he went to the server station and got the updated menus for us to look at, which was a bit strange and should have been given to us in the first place. The food was well received by the group, but took a very long time and the portions are small. If you are very hungry this might not be the place for you to go, but for a small bite it would be fine.

name: Mansurs on the Boulevard
address: 5720 Corporate Blvd A, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Awesome spot in a quiet area for dinner dates! It came to my surprise that Mansurs is able to accommodate large parties as well. They have many specials especially with seafood depending on the season. You can't really go wrong with anything on the menu. The Duck Mansur topped with shrimp scampi is a personal favorite of mine and will be looking forward to trying their seafood options in the future!
Ahi Tuna, dozen oysters on the half shell, shared seafood salad. Great choice for a quick bite at the bar.

Omg!!! So good. Food was amazing,  service was great, drinks were delicious. 5 of us came for dinner. Great atmosphere that is a nice balance between quiet/romantic and fun energy.  Beautiful and clean area, quick service and attentive about clearing dirty/empty glasses and plates. Will definitely be back every time I come to town!!!!
Wonderful food, great service,  great atmosphere.  We had crab cakes,  spinach dip, shrimp and grits, steak and bread pudding.  All were outstanding.  Loved everything.

We had an incredible meal.  Everything was so very fresh and well presented.  Brandon was our server and he was extremely professional and polite.  He totally enhanced the whole experience. Highly recommend Mansurs for a total fine dining experience.

name: Juban's
address: 3739 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews:
Wow. 

The crab cakes were phenomenal. Very pleased with the amount of Thriller to filler ratio. Very solid depth of flavor. Fresh and flaky, not dry.

The shrimp were excellent as well. I could not get enough of that sauce. And the mango and bacon topped it off. 

The Hallelujah crab was five star. Tender and clean, not overcooked, and the potato was smooth and season perfectly. Those veggies...perfection 

The butter and bread were standard fare. The butter was so light, it did not have much of a butter flavor, and it was slightly sweet but not salty at all. The bread needed salt, kind of bland. 

The sensation salad was slightly oily, and could have used a little bit more zip with either Citrus lemon squeeze, salt or cheese.

We will be back.
Always a good experience. High quality food and service. Try the favorites or the chefs special, you really can't go wrong. The crab cakes are way more crab than cake and delicious.
We came for lunch. This place has great atmosphere! The service was excellent (Nick & team). The food looked and tasted great.

A Baton Rouge favorite in my wife’s family. Celebration and special occasions are great here with a nice Bayou / hometown touch. Whether it’s air, land, or sea food you’re feeling, you can something good here.
Good food and great service. Nice ambiance for a date night. Definitely recommend the crab cakes and the hallelujah crab.

name: Roux 61
address: 8322 Bluebonnet Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews:
Traveling from Dallas to Gulf Shores we decided to stop here for lunch because of the reviews. It was mixed for my family. Not really worth the trouble to stop. 

Some of the food was really good but there were lots of missed steps. Our waitress was very friendly but didn't listen to our order. We were missing several items ordered and the things we got were not done to request. 

I had the Delta Queen and the fish was really good. But the lobster cream sauce was not good. It was more like a creole Alfredo sauce. Way to over reduced to the point of a cheese sauce. Bread was horrible, hush puppies were worse. Even my daughter said her sandwich bun was gross. 

Iced tea was great as should be for the deep South. 

Not a place I would go out of the way for.

The food was so delicious.  Grilled oysters are a must.  The stuffed mushroom was also a welcomed surprise.  No complaints about the service or the food.  I'll have to go back and see what the rest of the menu has to offer.  The kids popcorn shrimp is enough to share.  My 6 year old son barely put a dent in it.

Very nice place food is excellent. They give you plenty of food when you order something. I think the prices are reasonable. I got the Fish platter combination and I also got the oysters. They were cooked first time for me with garlic and a little bit of breading. They were fantastic. The place sits right next to This Little River right on the water. The only problem I would have with this place is the people that go to seat you. There not the friendliest. But the actual waitresses and waiters are very nice. I went there twice already. Definitely a place I will go back to in the future. There's also believe it or not two different sets of bathrooms. So if you're in the back of the restaurant you have bathrooms or if your towards the front or middle of the restaurant you have bathrooms. Pretty nice

The oysters are outstanding! The shrimp and alligator cheesecake cake was very flavorful and unique. We were in town for my son's soccer tournament and someone told us about this. It was the only place we ate at twice the entire week. Everything I had, which was oysters and seafood, was delicious. The beer was cold and had 2 great servers!

AMAZING food. Especially the Shrimp and Alligator Cheesecake. Sounds weird, but it's amazingly good. Not sweet as the word cheesecake may sound, but instead savory and rich. The staff are very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. Definitely will be back. Hopefully, sooner than later.

name: The Chimes
address: 3357 Highland Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: It was good to my liking. To be honest the waiter had just started a month ago. She was very patient with me and she explained the menu very well. I had the chimes boat I think it was called. I had a wonderful time there. The salad I had was tossed in pepper jelly. It was not as presentable but it was okay

In general, I always enjoy The Chimes. Unfortunately, this first trip to the new rooftop patio did not meet that expectation. We went on a Sunday during brunch so, we figured it would be busy. It was. But, the food was good and the patio was really nice. We enjoyed the views, the weather and the people watching. What really ruined it was the service. We waited nearly an hour for a beer and, even after asking several of the staff a few times about it, still didnt get that beer until we were almost finished the meal. We also waited a really long time just to order anything at all and were only successful after flagging down several different people. We were never really sure who was our server since  we never saw the same person twice.  The staff was running ragged and almost impossible to catch. The patio experience definitely had a hectic and understaffed feel to it from the start to the finish of the meal. I strongly recommend more upstairs staff if only to avoid detracting from an otherwise very nice experience.

Decent place not as homey as the much larger one in Covington. Plenty to drink and eat + a few extra items.

It could use a touch of personality tho in the building and staff. Other than that great place for a weekend
Great food and Great customer service.  Special shootout to our server Deston who made every effort to give excellent service!!

The food was good but small portions. Too much presentation for my taste. Staff a bit young and too playful. Music too loud to talk, love music but i wanted to be able to visit being from out of town to see my cousin. Chadd was nice and courteous! Ty!

name: Mike Anderson's - Baton Rouge
address: 1031 W Lee Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70820, USA
reviews:
When I come to Baton Rouge this is a must, especially when craw fish is in season.

Great selection of local food and seafood that can rival seafood restaurants in my home of Seattle.  

The service is great and very knowledgeable about their menu and drink selections.

The interior is rich wood walls that bring a great feeling while you eat.

Parking is good and the place is easy to find.
I visit Mike Anderson's for lunch or dinner any time I visit Baton Rouge. It is my favorite restaurant there and in my opinion makes the best seafood in southern Louisiana!

Always have good service & delicious food. Atmosphere is very good?   I've never left disappointed. I got fried shrimp & fried onion rings.  Both were delicious.  Portion was too much for me to eat in one sitting so took the rest home for supper.  I reheated in my Emeril air fryer and they were just as crisp as they were for lunch.

Met a group of friends here for lunch. Hadn't been here in a few years but liked it when I had last eaten there. This time not so much. Service was slow, drinks were slower. Chowder was good but they rest of my seafood was mediocre. Had to ask for clean silverware as my fork was dirty.  They seem to have pretty good reviews so hopefully it was just an off day for them. Will give them a go when I'm back in BR. Pretty lengthy wait for lunchtime as well. Will update next visit.

The atmosphere was great. The waiter George was great. The raw, grilled and BBQ oysters were excellent. We as a 13 top did bombard them by initially ordering 5 dozens oysters, but the seared tuna had no flavor, the blackened tuna was over cooked as well as the Salmon. Of course the fired things were good and the sweet potato fries were delicious. I think the cook was overwhelmed with a lot of late parties. They close at 9 and we were served dinner at 9:30. :(

name: J. Alexander's
address: 6457 Bluebonnet Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70836, USA
reviews: Always a great choice - fantastic food and fast service.   Good bar with quality selection of wine & spirits.   Steak, fish, veggies all good.   Deviled eggs appetizer a great starter.

If you where looking for a place that was a bit more upscale in cultural black hole known as Baton Rouge. This place has decent steak and seafood. My mother loved the speckled trout. I had the emerald coast shrimp and it was well done.

I visit J Alexander’s frequently.  

The host and service are very good and attentive.  The service is also very consistent: the greeting is always the same as is the presentation of specials - no matter who is on staff.  The dining staff work together to fill empty glasses and remove finished plates.  Despite the mechanics, the staff are personable and knowledgeable about the menu and wines.

I typically order salmon, trout, red fish, or drum.  The salmon is prepared to the desired temperature.  The trout is usually prepared with a Cajun inspired spice.  It’s not spicy, and not too salty.  The red fish is prepared with a lemon butter sauce, which get on the side.  The drum is done with a creamy seafood sauce that is delicious and filling. 

There is an assortment of sides on the menu as well as 1-2 daily specials. I usually opt for the special because they are a bit more interesting.  The menu features the usual (broccoli, baked potato, fries, etc), and the specials range from fresh heirloom tomatoes to roasted beet salad to haricots.  

Overall, I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant.  The service is always great, and the food is delicious, fresh, and prepared to order.

I used to enjoy this restaurant, however I will never return. This publicly-traded company took $15 MILLION from the Paycheck Protection Program, (with help of Pinnacle Bank) beating out small businesses in our city that need funding. I WILL NEVER RETURN HERE! SHAME ON YOU!! Hopefully, you will be forced to close permanently and be denied Bankruptcy protection.

The ambience was perfect for a romantic evening but omg don't get me started on the crab cakes; they are hands down the best I've ever had anywhere, period!! They were full of crab meat & the buttery crust it was surrounded in, complemented it well. I wanted to go back the next day just to get some to go. The fries were even seasoned to perfection. Thank me later 🤤

name: Acme Oyster House
address: 3535 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: If you are looking for oysters this is your place.  Busy lunch location.   Everything is good and food comes out quick.   Friendly service and table side checkout.

Plenty of parking as this location is connected to a larger shopping center. We were greeted by a hostess and seated immediately. The waiter was quick in the beginning but was absent near the end of the meal. The menu was fairly extensive and the food came out quickly and was good. I would recommend this location to anyone in the area looking for good food (like jambalaya).

We visited the baton rouge location in January. The young lady in training as waitress and the young man training her were caring helpful answered our questions and helped us set up rewards points loyalty card. The food was wonderful. But today went back the staff was rude could not explain loyalty card not sure going back.

Enjoyed our servers enthusiasm. 

The food was good and served on time. 

The prices were fair. 

Definitely stop there again if ever presented with the chance

We sat for about 5-10 minutes before we had a waiter come up to us. It looked like there were 3 waiters and only like 6 tables sat in the restaurant. That being said, the seafood gumbo was yummy. I'm not from Louisiana, so I hope it was up to par. Heading to N'orleans. I should have a better idea then.

name: The Little Village
address: 447 N 3rd St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: I've been to this location numerous times and it is always just as fabulous as the previous time. I want to compliment the ENTIRE staff on my recent experience there on Christmas Eve. Everyone from the hostess to our fabulous waiter Jordan were phenomenal. With it being a holiday you never heard a single complaint about an employee having to work. Keep it up!

The servers push the wine menu too aggressively. You can definitely tell they are trying to up group bill total for tips. Avoid seafood and the wines on special. Otherwise amazing. The group garlic knot is a must.
Love this restaurant. Went with a group of 11. All were very happy with food choices. Love the bread and atmosphere. Not too noisy to enjoy conversation. Will be going back.
Has to be the best Italian food in Baton Rouge.  Best bread for sure - AMAZING!  Good bar.  Service is quick and friendly.  Put this on your list for places to eat in Baton Rouge!

This is our new favorite restaurant! My husband and I first came here for our seventh anniversary but we went to the Airline location. The food is absolutely incredible. Every year my husband and I have a fancy Christmas Eve dinner (we usually go to Fleming's) where we order everything we want without worrying about the bill. We loved The Little Village so much when we went for our anniversary date that we decided to start coming here for our big fancy Christmas Eve dinner. Everyone always says to order the bread so we started there and got all of the bread sides as well. The tapenade was perfect as well as the amazing red sauce and roasted garlic. Everything paired so nicely with the stunningly delicious bread. My husband ordered the veal alla parmigiana (you can tell in the picture that he loved it because it's almost completely gone) and I ordered a ribeye with jumbo lump crabmeat and bearnaise sauce. This was easily one of the best steaks I've ever had. We also decided to split the baked lobster mac and cheese (to die for). Everything also came with a side salad and a potato or vegetable of the day. We couldn't finish the cheddar mashed potatoes or half of the lobster mac so we got those to go. We thought we didn't have room for dessert but our waiter, Jeff, talked us into the sticky toffee pudding cake. It was a gingerbread-esque cake served with caramel gelato and warm toffee sauce. We ate every single bite. I will say that this restaurant is on the pricier side but definitely worth every penny.

name: Red Zeppelin Pizza
address: 4395 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Great pizza paired with an equally good selection of local beer. The ambiance is casual and fine for families. The pizza is good - it is the thin crust kind and gets the basics right. Recommend the artichoke dip and the Margarita pizza.

Excellent thin crust pizza and probably  the best spinach and artichoke dip I've ever had. Cool place but usually very busy. Expect it to take some time to get your food. Your patience will be rewarded.
This pizza place is amazing. Food is always on point and they have a ton of amazing draft beers. You can fill growlers here as well. The spin dip is, in my opinion, the best in baton rouge.
Happy hour at Red Zeppelin is awesome. Pizza is very inexpensive. It was an awesome day to sit on the patio. They have a pretty good beer selection too!

Great place. Parking is horrendous. Food is delicious. Once again parking and getting in to park is a hassle. That's really the only issue. Other than that the waitress was wonderful the bar was good.

name: Anthony's Italian Deli
address: 5575 Government St, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: Best Italian food in Baton Rouge hands down... Extremely consistent. I have eaten at all of the well known Italian restaurants in Baton Rouge and the surrounding area, and Anthony's is still my favorite for the last 18 years. A quaint atmosphere accompanied by great flavor.

I haven't been to Anthony's Deli since they moved into the new location, which was probably +5 years ago. I'm realizing now that their absence from my life is hands down the largest regret I'll ever have. The muffoletta I ordered could not have been more perfect, you can tell that the little Italian woman in the kitchen made it with love.
Best Italian anywhere very authentic and family owned operation.  Best people and best food in br!!

This place is amazing! My husband and I frequented it when we lived in LA and always make sure to drop by when we come for visits home! We usually order a couple of sandwiches to bring home with us! Their pepperoni pizza on muffuletta bread....I've yet to find anything better!

Anthony’s is an excellent lunch spot for a nice day even in the fall you can sit outside and enjoy the views on government street while you eat all done at Italian food. I love the pasta salad and also go simple at this place meatballs and spaghetti is the best. Friendly owners

name: Bellue's Fine Cajun Cuisine
address: 3110 Scenic Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70805, USA
reviews:
The owner was the nicest person I've met. Food was so delicious and his welding toys are so cool. Me and my family will definitely be there again when we are in town.
Thank you so much

I received a box of frozen products from this place as a gift. Worst Cajun food I’ve ever tasted. Being from Lafayette, Louisiana I consider it a real insult to call this food Cajun. Everything was gross! Maybe the food at the restaurant is good (big MAYBE) but don’t even think about buying a frozen product to make at home. They’re all TRASH!

The internet brought me to this place!  This is by far the most flavorful Cajun food I have eaten!!!  I had the Crawfish/shrimp etouffee with dressing, honestly there are no words to describe this fine delicacy.  I enquired about the glazed chicken (chicken souse) they sell in the deli fridge and they quickly offered a sample....  "that souse has flavors that pop in your mouth" is how my son described that to me.  The pecan pralines I took home have a perfect sweetness.  I will definitely make a pit stop here again or take a 7 hour road trip just to eat here!

These people hit the mark when they set out to be the best in fine Cajun cuisine. The deer and chicken sauce piquant is to die for and the pricing there is very low for the quality dishes that they serve.

Googled "Best Lunch in Baton Rouge" when leaving the airport and this place had the highest reviews. I wanted a real cajun experience and got just that. Exceptional hospitality and the food was GREAT. Served fast and hot. Highly recommend. A+

name: Poor Boy Lloyd's
address: 201 Florida St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: We were looking for a restaurant near the Mississippi walkway that was nice but casual and Poor Boy Lloyd's was perfect! I got the shrimp poor boy, and the bread had a nice crispy crust to it without being tough. The shrimp were lightly battered and fresh without being heavy or greasy at all. The sandwich had just the right level of spice to it and was full of flavor. The Mississippi Mud was one of the best desserts I've had in a long time. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had a great visit and will be back.

I'm visiting from out of town and I'm so glad I stopped here! The gumbo was awesome! Loaded with shrimp and crawfish! At least 3 of each in my tiny cup of it! The fried pickles were amazing! The best I've ever had! Spicy but not too spicy, crispy with a flaky batter and still crunchy! Three onion rings looked just as good and I can't wait to come back to Baton Rouge to visit again and try them! The bread pudding was heavenly! And I don't normally care much for bread pudding (but they were sold out of the Mississippi Mudd!) The Community Coffee was the perfect addition to the meal and the staff were all so incredibly friendly! I seriously can't wait to return! 🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

Ordered catfish and a salad. They brought me catfish and coleslaw but the waitress caught the mistake on her own and brought me my salad. Food was good. Everyone was very nice. Restaurant was clean and cool. Liked it, I would go back.
This place is very good. I would drive to eat here if I were hungry and in the area. Everything is always good and the atmosphere is old school. Good place to eat. Always enjoyable!!
Great food and staff. The onion rings are amazing. Highly recommend if you’re in Baton Rouge area.

name: Elsie's Plate & Pie
address: 3145 Government St, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews:
Let me start by saying that you cant let the exterior of the building fool you, what may almost come off as questionable quickly gives way to an updated interior with a touch of nostalgic history. The building is interior is well maintained, everything was clean, and the staff is immediately friendly.

 The food is prompt and fresh from the kitchen and tastes like home, the service is frequent and warm, and the desserts (and pies) are fantastic. They are worth what they charge, and while some of the foods might seem odd, they are well worth trying. Fantastic job and thank you so much for the experience.

Wonderful food and great service!!  We will definitely be back. So many things on the menu we want to try. We went during brunch and just didn't realize how busy they would be. But, our wait was less than they said and the food came out pretty quickly. Our server was super friendly as well. Everything was so good!  If they have the brussel sprouts as a side would highly recommend. Loved the Eye of the Tiger pie so much we almost took a whole one home.

Cute modern place with great food! Just discovered this place and decided to go with my mom. Everything was great. We shared the seafood pot pie and had a side salad that came with it. I liked the dressing that came with the salad as well! The pie was great too. Well come back and try the other dishes.

Excellent experience at Elsie's. It's just one of those places where you know everything is good and you have to limit yourself to one or two things. They pride themselves on their pies and deservedly so. We got the apple pie, which is baked to order. Brunch has some good local offerings but can't wait to come back and try more of the menu!

We love this little place, too bad it's downtown which is way across the city from us. On the rare occasion we are downtown (like once a year) we stop in at Elsies for some fantastic food and service in a casual atmosphere. And definitely save room for dessert!

name: TJ Ribs - S. Acadian Thruway
address: 2324 S Acadian Thruway, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Awesome is really all I can say. Visited this place traveling from Michigan to New Orleans. A coworker suggested I stop and try the platter. It was well worth the 1 hour detour coming from a stop in Arkansas. The platter had sausage, brisket, pulled pork, pulled beef, smoked turkey, 1/2 chicken, ribs, red beans and rice, potatoes and gravy, fries, and squash casserole. DELICIOUS...
Besides the AWESOME LSU atmosphere and FABULOUS STAFF, they had the biggest and best fried pickles I have ever seen! The Brisket Quesadilla just melted in your mouth!! Beyond Delicious!!
I never order wings, I’m not a wing person but I tried one from my friend’s order and they were pretty good!  Fun place.

This isn't the same restaurant I went to in the 90's
I'm afraid that restaurant died with TJ Moran. The service was great, but the food is meh. There was a time when Baton Rouge restaurants served food   that rivaled food found in New Orleans. Those days are gone. This restaurant makes food that rivals food you would find at a Denny's in Missouri. Wheres the passion? Very disappointing.

The food is always good. This last time the food was still good but there was something different about the beef rib. The platter use to have the beef rib included but that changed. Still a great place with very good food and drinks.

name: Solera
address: 4205 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Delicious! The gazpacho is summertime in a bowl. But, honestly, everything really was decadent and yet approachable and just plain good. The staff was attentive but not intrusive, full of great recommendations, friendly and knowledge about the menu.  I highly recommend Solera if you are looking for something different or just want to go some place special. This is it.

My son and I stopped in for early tapas dinner on the advice of a friend, and I'm glad we did! We ordered two shrimp small plates (one skewered, the other with fabulous toasted bread) and the potatoes with manchego flaked on top - all were delicious! My pet peeve is overcooked shrimp, and ours were prepared perfectly. I also had a bowl of squash soup which tasted great and had a velvety consistency. Our service and cocktail were excellent. Highly recommend for authentic Spanish food!

This is my fourth time at this new restaurant and everyone I go with LOVES it. The food is incredible. Where are you gonna get tapas like this, I felt like I was in Spain. Tons of options for small shareable small plates plus a regular menu, something for everyone. The whole Branzino grilled fish was a wonder. Paella, vegetarian, all types of things. Amazing. Great cocktails too and the sangria is incredible. Its a must. We just sit and keep ordering tapas sometimes. Great service staff, super friendly.

Solera is something new and fresh in Baton Rouge!  The food is super good -- the tapas offerings are unique and tasty.  They have good cocktails and extensive wines and wine knowledge.  The entrees we have had are also excellent.  We've been twice and haven't been disappointed with anything.  The Romesco sauce is different and so good!   You really need to try it!
The owner greeted me. I had an excellent experience. Highly recommend. Will be back for more!

name: The Kingfish Grill
address: 201 Lafayette St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Never having tried Louisiana Gumbo, I ordered room service after traveling from 1am on to get to Baton Rouge, by noon I needed to order lunch. No menu in the room however, went on the Hilton Capital Center to find a brunch menu. Next, called down to place my order, all good so far. Got a call back about half an hour or so later and they didn’t have what was on the menu, and all the prices likewise were different. The food arrived about an hour and a half later, but I also knew they were slammed. The wait was well worth the Gumbo, best Gumbo hands down I’ve ever tasted. I would suggest menu’s in the rooms or directions about room service and menus at check in and update the online menu, it was not terribly difficult to look up, but it took some doing, and then wasn’t correct. The person on the phone was super friendly to ask what else I would like, since what I ordered didn’t exist and brought some extra cokes for the wait and cheesecake. I didn’t order fries but I guess they came with the sandwich, man, the fries were so darn good also! I would recommend their food, the restaurant is highly sought after, so the wait is expected to some degree, but the food is worth the wait, the service was accommodating so if not staying in the hotel for sure make reservations. The Kingfish is set in the Hilton Capital Center Baton Rouge, there’s an inspiring eclectic riverscape circle of cultural sites surrounding your dinning experience. Don’t forget to grab your bowl or cup of gumbo, the hotel itself is well worth a tour, or even a stay if out of town, for a much needed respite, or artistic inspiration. It is a historic hotel, it was left empty for over 25 years, the restoration is magnificent, and it does have a bit of a haunting feel FYI. The hotel was still working on opening old tunnels that run from the Capital Building to under the hotel, from the days of Gov. Huey Long (assassinated in 1935) so I didn’t get to see that part but it should be a cool tour once they complete the excavation.
Awesome restaurant located in the Hilton Baton Rouge.  I went there for dinner and had their Crawfish linguini.  It was fantastic.
Loved it they had breakfast in the morning and the young people where awesome and kind one day ill be back
Went for our anniversary and they did not disappoint.
I loved the drinks. I went to the bar but didn't spend the night there. However, nice ambiance and awesome drinks.

name: Eliza Restaurant
address: 7970 Jefferson Hwy j, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: Adorable place we had lunch at and enjoyed a few different dishes! Very good southern food.

I really had high hopes for this place after seeing one of their dishes in a magazine. It is a fancier type atmosphere prices accordingly. I do not mind paying for quality i prefer quality to  quantity any day. But overall I was let down on our first trip here. The food all looked great and presentation was nice I will give them that.

The fried green tomatoes appetizer was very good though the remoulade type sauce on it was a bit on the sour side for me especially going on an already tangy vegetable. The shrimp on top were big and cooked perfectly. 

I ordered the fried seafood platter with all 3 items fish shrimp and oysters for 25 dollars. I was very disappointed in just about all of it. The catfish had a very muddy fishy dirty flavor that allot of places that serve catfish have but the good places have clean tasting catfish, this place was on the bad side of that but not the worst I've ever had. The oysters were very small and also had a strong fishy dirty taste unlike oysters I get from other places that I frequent,  and the fries were soggy and tasted just like the oysters and somehow even more of a fishy smell and taste to the fries. The shrimp were good, the coleslaw was just ok. Their tatar sauce was also not to my liking. I am much more pleased with I get at other places for around 17 bucks with much better seafood

My girlfriend got the eggplant and crawfish pasta. It tasted ok but was very dry not much of any sauce on the noodles. The eggplant was way undercooked and the crawfish tails had to be chinese , they were super tiny and hard as rocks kinda rubbery with no flavor. For 17 dollar pasta dish we were highly disappointed I cannot believe they use chinese crawfish tails or if they arent chinese they are the tiniest ove ever seen come from Louisiana.

Over all after tip it was 70 bucks for lunch for less than mediocre food, maybe we ordered stuff they aren't their best dishes but we maybe may not return for another attempt.

In all honesty I have had much better meals with similar food at casual style seafood and poboy shops with just as big if not bigger portions.

I also ordered a dirty martini on their 1.50 happy hour and it tasted like an entire glass of olive juice with a splash of gin.

It wasnt the worst meal I've ever had but not near satisfied from a sort of place this is supposed to be

Love it !!! The service was great and it’s very clean ! The hamburger is juicy, the margarita is just right and the fish is fried well! It’s tucked away in a corner with a nice atmosphere. I will definitely be returning here.

was extremely excited about going to try Eliza’s because many colleagues have recommended this gem. But upon arriving today my mind was changed. I went today thinking I was going partake in some delicious food and spirits but that was changed once we met the bartender/ manager. My cousin who like me uses LA Wallet. For people who
are not familiar LA Wallet is your mobile version of your drivers license. Not a picture but an actual app that we (I) pay monthly for. The bartender/ manager told us that she could not accept the LA Wallet because the owners do not accept it as a valid form if Id. When asked if I can speak to the manager/owner she informed me that she was the manager has the final say. But it’s the tone and matter of fact in her voice that made the situation even worst. It almost made me upset because other people were not asked for proper ID. Was it because we were of a different race. Regardless I will not be returning.  I work in the customer service/ hospitality field for 16 plus years and I’ve  never been more disrespected and discriminated against. If you are not going allow people to use State approved, bill passed ID. I recommend it’s posted. And have your manger have more empathy without being rude!

Been here 5 times now & each time the food has been great. Fried Green Tomatoes were done perfectly and had fried shrimp & house made sauce on top of each was good as well. Bowl of Gumbo tasted really good also.

name: Chow Main
address: 501 Main St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Great staff and nice healthy food but it is pretty bland.  Noodles had no flavor and the chicken was alright.  Some sauce options that you could add from packets or bottles would go a long way here to compliment your food since its healthiness draws away from the flavor a bit.

Best modern Asian fast-food in Baton Rouge! The service is quick, the food comes out fast and is delicious! The Sloppy Zhou is a must-try for anyone who likes Sloppy Joes. This great new restaurant is also fantastic for vegetarians. There are TVs on the wall and yes they have soft drinks and water. The location is literally facing Main Street, just outside of the Main Street Market. The owner, Austin Wong, is here all the time and really gets to know all his customers. Try this place, you'll really like it! Two thumbs up!
Best shrimp tacos ever.  Quality corn tortillas, great flavors in the shrimp and sauce.  Great take-out option downtown.

If you are looking for something out of the ordinary but don't want toempty yout pockets this is is the place. It is a modern twist on traditional Chinese fare. Portions are huge. Service is extra friendly, the go above and beyond to make sure you enjoy your experience. The decor is fun too. Full of flavor and several health choices. Great for vegans and vegetarians. Check it out now!
Awesome, original food and concept. A must if you’re downtown for lunch.

name: Doe's Eat Place
address: 3723 Government St, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: There's not many places to get a good steak in Baton Rouge but if you're craving one, Doe's Eat Place is where you need to go. Holy tastebud delight! My steak literally melted in my mouth almost like butter it was so good! Angry Shrimp, Oyster salad, drop biscuits, an 11 ounce fillet and don't forget dessert! You will leave stuffed but looking forward to your next visit 😉
The steak was great! The rest of the food was fine, nothing spectacular. I wish they had smaller steaks available, though.
2½lb Porterhouse... Perfection! Service was outstanding! Best steak I've ever had! Ever! Thank you Doe's!
Absolutely delicious! Steak was flavorful and cooked to perfection. Service staff were friendly, courteous and attentive. It was my first time eating  at Doe's but not my last.
Amazing as always!  Don’t on in the burger. Best I’ve ever had.

name: Faye's Subs and Salads
address: 311 3rd St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Very good food, good customer service and friendly and patient employees. Explained the options to my kiddos as we'd never been there before. My only complaint was the music, had my little kids in there and they were playing music with tons of f-words and other garbage language.

I have never once had any topping or meats that was anything less than fresh and delicious and high-quality. eating there, you can definitely sense the pride and love that there is in their craft of making sandwiches.I know that sounds kind of silly, but it's kind of an interesting thing to enjoy if you go there. I highly recommended out of every other sandwich shop in downtown.
This place is terrific...better than any chain sandwich shop hands down. Excellent service and wonderful food. Don't pass Faye's by if you are visiting Baton Rouge!
The subs and salads are fair priced and you get a large portion for your money.  Excellent downtown lunch location with speedy service.
The sandwiches are good. Nice place to go on lunch break

name: Fleming’s Prime Steakhouse & Wine Bar
address: 7321 Corporate Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: Every time I come to Fleming's I sit in the bar. The service is outstanding. The bartender Tyler always makes sure everything is to perfection. Fleming's probably has the BEST happy hour in the city and not just for drinks but also for food. This time I came in I was celebrating my birthday late and I came with my friend and we started off with the Crab Cakes and shared the 35oz Tomahawk Ribeye and got the Fleming's Potatoes and Creamed Spinach for our sides. We finished off with the Chocolate Lava Cake and it was all phenomenal. I highly recommend Fleming's because of the atmosphere, food, and the service I always receive.

We visited this establishment as a continuation of marriage celebration. It was Absolutely Awesome!! The cuisine is soooo Good!! You must try it. We will be returning. My compliments to the Chef and all of the staff. We thoroughly enjoyed our evening here!☺️☺️☺️

Went to Flemings for lunch this past Friday and I had a delicious lunch but the service was not up to Flemings standards. I sat in the bar and ordered salmon with a barbeque glaze and a side of sweet potatoes. When I say delicious I mean it was delicious, but the server / bartender was not up to Flemings standards. She did not greet me and barely checked on me after I ordered. There was one other person sitting at the bar eating lunch and she talked to him just about my entire lunch. Usually the bartenders are top notch at Flemings. I have been going there for 12 years and the last 2 times the food was excellent but the service was mediocre to bad. This is why I'm giving a 3 star rating.I don't want to see one of my favorite restaurants go down because of bad service. When you're paying $40 for lunch for one person - the food and service should be top notch and a 5 star experience.
Had curbside service from Flemings tonight and the food was fantastic.    Everything was cooked to perfection and tasted delicious .   Get out there and support your local Flemings.

Wow. I haven't had a meal experience like this before! The service was impeccable, very friendly and attentive. The bread was done of the best I've ever had, crusty and soft. I had the Sunday special, three-course filet and lobster, ceasar salad and key lime pie. Incredible deal for INCREDIBLE food! I am so grateful to God for such wonderful experiences. Praise the Lord!

name: Tsunami Sushi Baton Rouge
address: 100 Lafayette St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Can't say enough good things about this place!  Incredible food.  Incredible view.  Great vibe!  Never disappointing.
The service is always excellent and accommodating. Taylor was our latest great waitress. The baked salmon should be named crab surrounded with salmon. Great lunch.

In planning a birthday dinner for my daughter, I reserved a table of ten thinking it would be to our advantage.  Getting to the restaurant our table wasn’t ready, the food was extremely slow to come out while orders weren’t correct, and finally our bill didn’t reach their “minimum” of $350 for a group booking. I had to pay $350 even when our ticket was under 200!  Moral of the story...don’t make a reservation for a larger group!!  Tsunami put a damper on our celebration. We should have gone elsewhere-

I had such a wonderful sushi lunch here ! The food was delicious! The service was friendly and attentive. The GM even took the time to come check on me and my experience. Aside from all that, there is no comparison in the category of atmosphere in Baton Rouge! That river view skyline is incredible! Food & Drink: I had the Green Monster roll and it was DELICIOUS and refreshing!!! Their cocktails are delightful too. I don't even want to attempt to type the name but it started an F lol! One of my favorite sushi restaurants in Baton Rouge.

i dined here one evening while in town for business. i was seated very quickly upon arrival and the waitress was very attentive and nice. i ordered some soup and then ordered the sea bass for my meal. the sea bass was amazing. one of the best tasting meals i have had in a long time. however, i was very shocked when my bill came and the market price for a piece of fish was $48... considering i have had a bunch of sea bass, and i know it's one of the more expensive fish, i was shocked to see they were charging roughly $50 for about 5 oz of fish. other than that, the meal was great and i would be back. i loved watching the sunset from up top over the river

name: Beausoleil Restaurant & Bar
address: 7731 Jefferson Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: A nice French cafe vibe offers excellent service and truly outstanding cuisine. It may be on the pricey side for some, but you do get what you pay for. Take a chance, you won't be sorry.

Food and atmosphere for both wonderful. This is a fine dining establishment and priced accordingly. The 14 oz bone in rib eye was fantastic mushrooms and sauce compliment it perfectly.  V Pan roasted chicken breast was slightly crisp on the outside and super tender on the inside with the pesto butter was outstanding. We did not care for the cabbage it was a bit tart sort of a vinegar flavor. The crawfish fries for the appetizer was also delightful. The oysters Rockefeller soup Was enjoyed immensely by both of us comes with a  Fried oyster on top. The white chocolate bread pudding and the chocolate pot de creme was probably 2 of the best desserts we have ever had had a restaurant.  We had very good service and all of the courses came out perfectly timed

What a great meal. The entré was duck with spaetzle and tomato jam. The sauces were excellent. The brussels were fried, and had a sweet molasses style glaze. The shrimp and gnocchi was simply excellent. The peanut butter cake topped it off. We got the cake togo because we were so full after dinner. The cake was excellent!!
Wait staff was nice and attentive. Food was cold. Would expect that not to be the case for an expensive restaurant.
Great food. Blackened Gulf fish was well presented and very flavorful. Craft cocktails are top notch. Definitely worth coming back.

name: Frank's Restaurant
address: 8353 Airline Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70815, USA
reviews: Frank's on Airline has been a constant for us for a couple months now. We go for lunch often throughout the week and have never had a bad meal. The staff has always been almost as good as the food! (Joking) We love it and think you will too. 😁

The prices are a bit steep but the amount and quality of the food you get for the price is definitely a bonus. You can just go to cracker barrel up the road a bit and get almost the same thing but at cracker barrel you won't get the amount, quality or hospitality that you will at franks. In my opinion id rather pay a little more money and get a better overall experience then go the cheap way out.
The food was good. The chicken livers and gumbo were delicious. The corn poppers were my favorite. The shrimp poboy was a little dry. If I went back I'd request it to be grilled instead of fried.

Awesome. Great family oriented restaurant. The staff always greets you with a smile and a hello. The food is the best by far. It's like being at home with family. I highly recommend this place for breakfast and lunch. Just a good ole hometown feel with great service and great food.

Great food great service. The server that helped us, I think his name was Kory, was very helpful. I had the Atchlafalya benidict, OMG it was awesome. Alligator sausage was so good we bought 3 lbs to take home to Georgia. My husband had the seafood grand omelet. It was very good as well.  So glad we stopped for breakfast. If we ever come back through we will stop at Frank's.

name: George's
address: 2943 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Bomb local spot in Baton Rouge. Been coming here for years. Food is on point and excellent service to match. Super laid back atmosphere. They also have weekly specials, this is the Oysters Acadiana 😋🤤
Had a great time here. We're from New Mexico and it was really fun
Great service and great food! Will definitely be back
Fun, quirky establishment! Servings were big & very tasty.  Worth trying....worth going back!
Small but nice. Sweet girls behind bar. Loved the fried fish. Go LSU!

name: Chow Yum Phat Overpass
address: 2363 Hollydale Ave, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: They were nice enough to give me the curry fish during lunch time and it was good! Could be a little less salty though imo but would def give it a try.  4/5 taste wise but 5 stars for Google would go again.  Glad to have more Asian food in BR.
I love this place. Just took my family there. The service was great and the food fantastic. Definitely recommend.

Amazing and SO romantic! Best ambience in town! EVERYTHING is good!!!! Wings, and cauliflower are above and beyond, though.. OMG! Baos at lunch are phenom (and only available at lunch) so don’t think you’re missing out by not making it to dinner.. The manager (Kyle) is also wonderful, super knowledgeable, and will make everything feel as if it’s going to plan despite the restaurant being super packed. 10/10.. will visit again!! Baton Rouge needed this one!
Great ramen spot!  Featuring dumpling and Bao.  Vegetarian options available as well.

We have eaten here several times since it opened and been extremely pleased with the quality of the service and the exceptional quality of the food! The ramen bowls are all delicious (Oskar is my personal favorite) and the pork belly fried rice dish is smoky and amazing. Also, be sure to try the cold sake or a specialty drink. There is a very nice outdoor seating area where we were able to bring our dog. I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant to anyone from or visiting Baton Rouge!

name: Kalurah Street Grill
address: 2857 Kalurah St, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Simply amazing! Went here for my birthday and was not disappointed! I had the fried chicken with greens and my wife ordered the shrimp scampi. Appetizers we shared lamb meatballs. Highly recommend

Definitely an intimate date setting or formal business meeting dinner type of feel. The lighting is dark inside, and the music is softly playing in the background. I came here with a group of old friends, and we had great time! The food and service were impressive! I ordered the fried chicken with collard greens and cornbread. I have to admit, these were the best collard greens and fried chicken I’ve ever had. However, the location of the restaurant was hidden and somewhat hard to find. The prices were a bit more expensive than I was anticipating considering the location of the restaurant.

We frequent K Street for dinner and drinks and always have a wonderful experience. When my 16 year old son asked where to take his Valentine date, Kstreet was the choice. I appreciate the respect they gave a 16 year old as they created an experience that impressed his date.
Good atmosphere, good service, but the food did not taste very good. Not good dishes compared to the price.

Went there last night and had the best customers service we had, had in a while! Darien was extremely knowledgeable about the menu, great with the wine, and fantastic with all of the recommendations he gave. Our first impression was solidified when he became our waiter. The food and drinks were SUPERB that  would we would visit again, but his customer service definitely knocked it out of the park for us!!!

name: The Gregory
address: 150 3rd St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews: Great dining experience! We made reservations for my sisters 45th birthday. The food was delicious, presentation was awesome and the staff was excellent. If you're looking for a delicious steak in Baton Rouge with a great ambiance this is it! Ember was our server and provided QUALITY service!

The Gregory is located inside the lobby of the Watermark Hotel. There is plenty of parking nearby. We dined in for dinner for Valentine's Day. The atmosphere inside is wonderful. I ordered the steak and my wife had the duck. While the steak was underwhelming, the duck was incredible. The drink selection rotates and features mostly local brands. The craft cocktails were delicious. When I am in town for another holiday I will definitely consider coming back.

Food was very good. The decor is nice and there's a persistent subtle goose theme to the restaurant which is kind of endearing even though geese are vicious. Found the drinks to be too sweet, but otherwise a great experience.
Incredible place, really. A gem of the city. Have eaten here three times and haven’t been disappointed yet. I will say the wine prices are a bit pricey... ($12-25 per glass?!)

I absolutely loved visiting the gregory. It is located inside the watermark hotel. The building used to be the old Louisiana national bank and it still remains inspired from its history. Every thing is marble and the basement  includes 3 vault style conference rooms.

name: Christina's Restaurant
address: 320 St Charles St, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: Christina's was easy to find with google. I arrived at opening so there was no wait. I was greeted by friendly staff. I picked my table.  Annie was my server and is cordial. I ordered two eggs scrambled, grits, bacon with wheat toast. I must say, this is my second visit to Christina's and the food is still DELICIOUS !!! Everytime I am in Baton Rouge, I will dine here.

This was a great spot for lunch. Went after touring the Old Governors mansion. Great selection of menu items and good lunch specials. Had the catfish special on a Friday. It was nicely done. The wife had a grilled chicken. The southern sides and sensation salads made the meal.

A very well-known, local restaurant, and the food is high-quality and cooked to perfection. My first time here today, went to pickup lunch for my office. It's a small place. It's hot lots of character and history in it. Parking lot in front is small, so there's a side lot for parking just on the side street. Very happy with my experience. I will be going back.
Great lunch eatery.  Fast and friendly service.  Large portions.  Great dessert!
Great little breakfast spot in Baton Rouge. The staff were so welcoming and the service was great! We ordered omlette, french toast, eggs, and all the sides.

name: The Chimes East
address: 10870 Coursey Blvd #4019, Baton Rouge, LA 70816, USA
reviews: One of the waitresses in The Chimes on Coursey was very RUDE because I used a chair from an empty table to sit my purse on. This was during the very early part of lunch hours around 11:30am where traffic in the restaurant was sporadic.  The waitress came over, while my friend and I were conversing and spoke with my friend inquiring if it was her purse in the chair. I informed the waitress that it was mine and she asked me to remove it. I informed her that I'm not a rude person and if someone comes and need to sit in that chair I will remove it.  I asked for the manager and another waitress. The manager came over, very RUDE, to say the reason the restaurant needed the chair was to hold it as a placement. Again I informed her that I'm not rude and since the hostesses are placing other customers upstairs, it shouldn't be a problem. The manager then proceeded to bring me a mangy chair from the back of the restaurant to sit my purse on. I declined her offer, so she sat the mangy chair in public view in stead where the other chair was. I inquired to my friends if they wanted to leave but they refused to let anyone drive them away. The replacement waitress name was Chloe. She changed the whole atmosphere with her pleasant attitude. She said that she's a server and she's there. at The Chimes on Coursey, to make sure the customers have a great experience. The kicker of this story was that a group of 4 came and sat by us, remember I have the extra chair, one of them noticed the chair was missing as I was trying to place it back,  the lady politely shook her head no, and got the other chair by an empty table. The lady said if someone comes by looking for it, they'll give it to them. However when the waiter/waitress noticed that the chair was missing from the empty table nothing was said. The prior waitress or the  manager didn't apologize for their rudeness. The food was very delicious, as it WAS one of my favorite go to places. But the professionalism on that day of January 25, 2020 was very devastating, demeaning. and unacceptable. I will not go back and spend my hard earned money at The Chimes to get demised and humiliated...

Awesome Cajun food here. Place can get very packed so make sure you come here at certain times. Especially when there’s a busy bar at the place. The food is very tasty, flavorful and filling. Definitely recommend giving this place to try if you’re in town.

Everything was awesome. My food's quality was consistent with how it always is, and my waitress was great as well. The atmosphere was inviting and friendly. As usual, the upkeep was up to par, so I have "0" complaints about any aspect of my visit. Both my cousin and I had a pleasant experience dining and visiting at this establishment.

The food was delicious and a lot of food was provided. The chicken wings are some of the best. The salmon plate was incredible and the grilled chicken breast was amazing. I honestly couldn't believe the price for the quality and quantity. I'll definitely be back here to eat soon!

This place is the mac daddy. It is by far one of the finest establishments in the country. The craft beer selection is a 10 +. The menu is loaded with Razzle Dazzle and the food quality and taste is absolutely exceptional. All of the bartenders are super friendly and attentive. The decor and environment is outstanding. The bourbon and liquor selections behind the bar seem endless. You cannot go wrong picking this place for a nice dinner or drink.

name: Maison Lacour French Restaurant
address: 11025 N Harrells Ferry Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70816, USA
reviews: My parents, Terry and Joyce Ryder treated us to Maison Lacour curbside tonight. Just absolutely amazing. Every single thing we ordered. Please help support our local restaurants during this crazy, uncertain time!! The food was fabulous ❤️❤️
Great lamb chops

Wonderful food, wonderful service, perfect setting. We will be going here on a regular basis. This Restaurant makes me believe that there is hope for Baton Rouge's food scene. 
Reservations required for dinner and they are closed on Sunday and Mondays.
Best restaurant in Baton Rouge in my opinion. Food quality is unmatched and great service also. A very good and affordable wine selection too.
Hidden French gem in Baton Rouge.

name: P.F. Chang's
address: 7341 Corporate Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews:
PF Chang's is consistently a great place. Especially if you have an open mind to plate sharing. 

Today I got the Mongolian Trio for my entree.

It's an off menu item, but they are kind enough to do it from time to time. 

Of course we started off with the lettuce wraps, but I was unable to get a picture before we devoured them.

Food was pretty good but just a whole bunch of vegetables that takes away from the main dish of Sesame Chicken. Tried the Moonstone Asian Pear as it was good. The waiter at the bar was very attentive and polite. All around good place to drink, eat and chill. Nice atmosphere

The restaurant looks good but the menu is quite weak.  The portions are among the smallest and the taste of the food is completely lacking.  I took Mongolian Beef which was just fried meat with onion, just so, without any taste.  I was upset because the menu was past the price for lunch and normal price.  I went to lunch and I was charged the high price.  I do not recommend this place.  There are many other city-specific restaurants on a much higher level.

My family really enjoyed the incredible meal at this location although the new Brussel Sprout dish was a “hate it or love it” only.  This dish is very tart.  They also have a nonalcoholic Ginger Beer that will make you want a refill. The atmosphere was pleasant and the service was great. This will be a place that I would recommend returning to again and again.

We just had dinner here, and we had an enjoyable and pleasant experience. The service is always great, from the host to the servers, everyone works together to get the job done. My husband ordered the Salmon with the glaze on the side. The team in the back realized they made the Salmon wrong. After a very brief delay, the chef himself brought out the correctly prepared Salmon just as my husband ordered it and he apologized for the error. Wow! I have never seen that before. Talk about great customer service!! Everything was cooked to perfection. Our waitress was so attentive and nice.We drove over 1 hour to eat here and it was worth it!

name: La Contea Italiano Ristorante
address: 7970 Jefferson Hwy ste f, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: The food here is exquisite! It's apparent they use all fresh ingredients. The food didn't come out quickly but, we didn't wait long either. They pay attention to detail with their food & take the time to make sure it comes out properly to the coustomer. The cocktails we had were presented beautifully &, tasted very good. The alcohol per mixture ratio was perfect. The atmosphere is very clean & elegant. The prices are high but if, they continue putting out excellent food & service. I don't have a problem with it. I can honestly say, this is one of the best Italian Restaurants I've ever eaten at. I Will be back.

EXCELLENT !!!! VERY GOOD AND AFFORDABLE PRICES, VERY GOOD FOOD. I enjoyed the atmosphere. The staff very friendly and professional. The food was so far THE BEST I ever had in Baton Rouge. I will definitely come back again. I love it !!!

Quite a wonderful experience, the staff was inviting and friendly. The dining room had a subtle elegance with the circular shape and the lighting gave it a romantic level of class. Each table was set and ready for you to enjoy some of the best italian food I've had in the Baton Rouge area. The food came out timely with filling portions and with quality that rivals places like the Little Vilage and other similar joints. A very nice choice for a special night with a loved one.

I have eaten here quite a few times now. The service is always great. They checked on us a few times throughout our dinner and even poured our wine for us. Prices are especially reasonable considering the atmosphere and the quality of service and attention provided to each table. Modern design aspects that don't take away from a great feel of an Italian restaurant. Went on a Saturday night and enjoyed live piano music! Definitely returning for more great experiences.
Eggplant parm, Italian cream cake for dessert. Delicious! Great service. Will definitely come again.

name: BLDG 5 Market | Kitchen | Patio
address: 2805 Kalurah St, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: I came across BLDG5 after looking for prepared meals for pick up. The menu looked awesome and during these times it is difficult to find a healthy, well rounded meal from the grocery stores. Many are picked over and being 34 weeks pregnant my only trips are to my OB appointments. My husband and I ordered lunch from the regular menu ahead of time - he ordered the original chicken sandwich and I ordered the short rib sandwich. It was by far the best sandwich I have ever had. My husband also raved about his sandwich. We ordered the blueberry lemonade and it was very tasty. My husband told me pick up was easy, he stayed in the car, called ahead and they brought everything out to him. We also ordered frozen meals and a prepared meal. It was delicious. We heated up the food per the instructions and everything tasted great, all while getting the vegetables we have been lacking and proteins. Thank you to Amber for assisting with ordering ahead. She communicated quickly to me and  I really appreciated BLDG5 being able to make the frozen meals requested that were not in stock at the time. They really went above and beyond. We look forward to these times passing and being able to have a date night here, hopefully sooner than later!

Beautiful setting! Great patio with lovely outdoor seating. The drinks are great - well balanced and interesting. The boards are a lot of fun - great way to share a meal. Lots of options on them, with some delicious sauces. Highly recommend!

The best (and I mean BEST) vibes in Baton Rouge. Nuanced + classy design and feel, the cocktails are off the charts top-shelf, and the food is remarkably phenomenal. Easily my favorite place to eat in BR, thank you Misty and the whole team for realizing such an excellent vision in our city!
Amazing dinner last night.  Food is delicious.  The dinner boards are a great idea. Going back soon.

Fantastic restaurant all around! Food was delicious and well prepared, cocktails were tasty too! Atmosphere is exceptional and the wait staff and owners were friendly and informative. Can’t stop thinking about this place - excited to try other menu items soon! Thanks for 3 years of hard work w this plan - it paid off, BLDG5 is outstanding!😊

name: BRQ Seafood and Barbeque - Takeout Available
address: 10423 Jefferson Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: The pickles! Reason enough to visit. We have sampled all the BBQ options at this point and nothing negative to say. Same for the 3 or 4 non-BBQ items we've had so far.

The food. The location. The decorating of the building. The service. AND the location. Just love telling people about this spot!
You're welcome! ☺️

Really great meal. Everything we had was delicious from the pulled pork to the ribs to the Mac and cheese to the catfish and the sauce selection they bring out is really tasty (I liked the mustard one best!) the hush puppies were a great starter.

Delicious food, portion is huge and free potato chips and pickles! I ordered sliced brisket and smoked peas. I definitely recommend. It's close to I-10 if you are just thinking about having a quick lunch like we did.

The first time I went to this place not long after it opened, I really enjoyed it. The meats had excellent flavor and were cooked very well. On the most recent trip, the flavor was still there but everything was dry. I used a fair amount of BBQ sauce to help with that but there's only so much you can do. For the price, I expected better

name: Stinky's Fish Camp Baton Rouge
address: 5500 Hilton Avenue, First Floor, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Awesome experience dining here for it first time. Many have read my reviews of other restaurants and know I'm picky. Stinky's gets high marks in all areas. The restaurant was clean, the staff friendly and the food was on point. I had an oyster basket and my wife had the shrimp basket. Both were cooked to perfection with just the right amount of batter. My oysters were plentiful, served with a small container of coleslaw which was a different recipe than most places, it had pineapple, and was delicious (I wished there was more of it). There was also a generous portion of french fries that were an interesting cut, not too thin not too thick, also very good. We ordered a side of mac-n-cheese, which was a great move, best I've had in a restaurant in a long while. All-in-all, you can't go wrong here.

We went for Happy Hour half priced oysters. The waiter took the order after 10 minutes the manager (I assumed)
 came to the table with drinks. I had a question about the oysters, when I asked her she said we don't have any oysters. My waiter never told us this, so we really were waiting for nothing. Then the manager said well since you have already been waiting let me see what I can do, comes back in 5 minutes to say, "Yeah we're out." 
That's confusing! If you knew you were out why would you say you'll see what you can do?
Then I remembered she said they were out of Happy Hour oysters, so I wondered if I was there outside of Happy Hour would they miraculously have oysters again?!?!?

My son's pork nachos were good however.

Since we were staying at the hotel, we decided to dine there for dinner. Service was pretty quick and our waiter was helpful. The only issue I had was my catfish was quite salty. Also my dessert was frozen so if I knew that, I probably would have picked something else. Overall it was not bad.
Amazing food! They were a little slow for it not being very packed in the resturaunt, but the food made up for that. Great aesthetic.

We stopped here purely because of the name. We enjoyed the food and the service was friendly. Boyfriend ordered the “shoyster” po boy and I got the shrimp and grits. We also tried the oyster shooters, that was an experience to say the least.

name: Jolie Pearl Oyster Bar
address: 315 North Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: What a great place with outstanding oysters! We were craving fried tonight and Jolie hit the spot! It's kind of like a oyster sport bar if there is such a thing. I got a po-boy and the better half got a salad. We'll for sure be back to try out some of the other items.

Walked in about an hour before close and 5 STAR SERVICE AND FOOD! Definitely one of the best spots for date night or even group gatherings!!! Drink menu is awesome and best bloody Mary in town. Definitely will be home for our love of oysters!!!

This place is great and has very good service. The food is ok. The oyster selection is good, the atmosphere is good, and the prices are good. The three start eating is due to cleanliness. Clean your outdoor tables at least once a week, please. I've been to this location a lot and go because the outdoor seating is right across from the library. I love the decor inside, and I'll keep going back, but I shouldn't have to clean my own table.

Get ready if you really love oysters - these are the best I've tasted in a while! I had 4 of the Brie and Bacon and 4 house style chargrilled - the seasoning and preparations were delicious, but the oysters themselves were astounding! They were lush and fresh and juicy and cooked perfectly - I was so in awe that I took a close-up photo for you! The ouster was beautifully intact and firm, gorgeous and delicious. I washed it all down with yummy grapefruit margarita. The service was great, even though the lunch server was by herself. I wish I worked downtown! Highest recommendation!
I've never seen such big oysters in my life. Soooooo good!

name: Warehouse Restaurant
address: 12328 S Choctaw Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70815, USA
reviews: Unassuming place serving comfort food for breakfast and lunch. Daily specials are great. You won't leave hungry. Or broke!
Great breakfast, very friendly staff and I shall return

If you miss mother's home cooking then you won't be disappointed when you dine here! I would recommend to anyone to skip the fast food restaurants and give yourself a treat at Warehouse restaurant.
This place is clean, friendly and offers a generous serving with a friendly price.
Great lunch, very friendly waitress/server, thank you Wanda!
We have been eating here for years!  Always consistent food. Breakfast is the best in town

name: El Magey Mexican Restaurant
address: 8290 Siegen Ln E, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: Very good food with lots of variety and at a fair price. The setting is humble but clean.  Friendly staff and sweet Mama Gwen seating the guests. All you can eat at $13.95 for adult dinners.

I can't say enough good things about this place.
The food on their buffet is so tasty and fresh.  
Ranchero beans!
I don't live in Louisiana any more but any time I am there for a visit, this is a must.
I travel extensively in the US and have looked for something that equals this and never found it.
One of the best Mexican buffet's I've ever had.  All food was fresh and outstanding.  They even had ridiculously good BBQ ribs on the buffet for lunch.

I was extremely pleased with this place. Every dish was just as good as the last with a surprisingly big selection. Very reasonably priced (especially since everything was so good) That's not to mention the hospitable service from start to finish. Will be coming back and highly recommended to try.

This food is so delicious and well seasoned. Also VERY, VERY CLEAN.  This is one of the Cleanest Mexican Restaurants I've been in.  I wish yall  sold Margaritas.  I had a girls party that wanted to come but they didn't come because there were no Margaritas.  So I will bring my hubby next time.

name: Capital City Grill
address: 100 Lafayette St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews:
