We visited Capital City Grill on a Saturday evening and made sure to check the closing time, 10:30pm, before we arrived since it was a bit late-9:00pm. There was a large party finishing up and another table was seated after us, so we didn’t feel bad about it being too late. 

We ordered drinks and I had my heart set on something small like an appetizer of fried green tomatoes! Unfortunately, the tomatoes came out soaked in a melted sauce that made the breading soggy and unappetizing. I was able to eat one that was resting on top, but the others I couldn’t eat and the breading fell off. The really nice server took the appetizer off of my bill, so I was thankful for that great customer service. Our table ordered the seafood pasta and grilled chicken dinner. Both meals were ok, but we felt that the quality of the dish didn’t match the prices. 

The restaurant was really nice and cozy, clean bathrooms and a really friendly server. I would go back and try again during a lunch hour.

What a blast! Great place to meet with friends on a Friday evening and be able to have a nice conversation, it's not too loud but great atmosphere.  This place has excellent service and food. Highly recommend the tuna. It also has an excellent location close to rue Lafayette .

Had an awesome time with friends during our company dinner last night. Saw at least two happy birthday party at the restaurant so this is nice.
Pros: Excellent spot in downtown with a lot of customer and The staffs are attentive and very nice. The food is pretty decent and the speed is not a wait at all. The atmosphere is really awesome. The restroom is clean and they are not busy even on Friday. They offer wine and beer which is awesome and everyone loves it. What I like most about this place is the waitress service
Cons: It is hard to find a parking lot on downtown at night especially on the weekends. You may need to reserve a table before your meeting.
A SPECIAL TASTE OF DOWNTOWN BATON ROUGE. LOVE THE FOOD AND SERVICE

Honestly, I'm not normally a fan of this restaurant. I don't find it has enough variety with good size portions for lunch or supper....BUT their brunch is absolutely amazing! Splurge! Go for the seafood omelet. It is so yummy! The sauce with the crab...amazing! The mimosas are good, but not really that great of a deal in my opinion. They make you think it's all bottomless, but each glass of juice costs extra...but again that omelet, so worth it!

name: Superior Bar & Grill MidCity
address: 5435 Government St, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: Love it here! Been coming here for over 16 years. Always had Benny as server, always have a fresh, delicious lunch! Salsa is always great! All friends/family I brought over the years love it and always ask to go back. If you love authentic Mexican, this is best place in town!

The ambiance and aromas that hit you upon entering the front door is akin to winning the sensory lottery. This place just looks and smells authentic and amazing! Chips and salsa come out right away and are always really fresh and delicious. Margaritas are AMAZING, strong, and able to adjust any given attitude on any given day. The chicken fajitas are by far my favorite dish here. Queso is also fantastic! Give this place a try and see why I call it a FIESTA for your taste buds!
My all time favorite spot, nice dim setting, amazing food its always hot and tasteful. Great drinks. Great service. Nice people. Good spot for the whole family to enjoy.

This was our first time at Superior Grill. Let me start off by saying that Mexican cuisine is not my favorite. I only came because my wife loves it. I'm absolutely blown away by how amazing the food and service is here! I ordered the Fajita Steak Tampiquena and my wife ordered the Superior chimichanga. The steak was simply amazing! The marinade is delicious and it was cooked perfectly! My wife said "This might be the best Mexican food I've ever eaten!" and I'm going to agree with her. You owe it to yourself to try this place if you have never been!

Ordered 4 margaritas and 2 chicken fajitas Togo. It cost me $142. There was a service charge of $17 that I was not informed of. And on top of that I tipped them an extra $10. I got home with my food and drinks and found out I had to tortillas, no salsa, and no chips. I even asked the person who brought it all out of it had tortillas and he said yes. How do I get fajitas with out tortillas? At least the drinks were good.

name: Crawford's Restaurant
address: 1980 Staring Ln, Baton Rouge, LA 70810, USA
reviews: Average at best. The food is consistent and if you visit when its busy you will understand the average age of its customers. The sides dont stand out and the gravy looks and tastes like the powder packet from the grocery store. My hangup is the dining area. I personally made the decision to no longer dine in. The chairs and the tables dont look to be regularly cleaned or replaced. Even the napkin dispenser was dirty.  Yes, it's been here for a long time but that's not an excuse for not keeping things presentable.

Me and my Pops heard about this amazing home town restaurant from a local, we are out of town from Texas, wanting some delicious food on our way back home from NOLA.
We came here, and were greeted so kindly, with patience and delight.
The staff is incredibly hospitable, and whoever is cooking the meals, you can truly feel the love, care and pride in every bite.
If you are looking for some fantastic home cooked food that taste like your grandma is in the kitchen, come here. You will not be disappointed!!!
My first visit and the food was wonderful. I forgot to ask her name but the server was great. The grits were the best I've had in years. They cook over medium eggs just right. I highly recommend.

My two kids and I dine in here today. The waitress was very warm and polite, and quite patient as well. This place makes you feel like your right at home! The welcoming service was speedy without missing the homestyle taste!
A true feast!  Did not disappoint.  Friendly service, and free ice cream for the little ones.

name: Bonefish Grill
address: 7415 Corporate Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: The servers were nice and our primary server was kind and funny. It is a bit expensive but it had a great atmosphere that makes it worth the try. The food I got was good but not as worth the price in some cases and that's the only reason I'm not giving 5 stars.
Awesome experience! Our waiter Jacob was awesome. Not only was he a great waiter but he was also a bartender so I didn't need to wait for someone else to fix my drink. No complaints.

So, the service here is impeccable! Pam has made my experience so great, she is a very friendly person and she's definitely fit for this line of business, she makes me want to order furniture and move in! Thanks Pam!! Friendly staff, great food! I would definitely recommend this place to close friends, family & colleagues!

The Next Best Thing Other Than The Food And Atmosphere Would Have To Be The Servers. My Girl Pam Does An AMAZING Job!!! It’s Never A Dull Moment When Me And My Friends Come In, She’s So Full Of Joy And That’s What I Adore Most About Her. So If You Just So Happen To Take A Trip To Bonefish, Make Sure You Ask For Pam Trust Me You Won’t Regret It!!!!!!!!!
So freaking good! Excellent service. Had the coconut shrimp, salmon, and key lime pie! Off the chart. It was my first time to try Bonefish Grill but “I’ll be back!”

name: Stab's Prime Steak and Seafood
address: 7666 Jefferson Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: If you need an amazing place to go for an anniversary, date, or just to celebrate a special night out, I would suggest Stab's Prime. My husband and I enjoyed the atmosphere and the food was amazing! Delicious steak, lobster topped mac & cheese and Asparagus... and to finish it all off with a skillet cookie topped with ice-cream! Dustin was our waiter and he was phenomenal! Highly recommend :)

My absolute favorite for a quick cocktail and delicious meal on my lunch break! My go-to cocktail is a new fashioned (updated old fashioned) and their yummy seasoned fries... and then I’ll add different entrees each visit. Sonya, Jeff, and Allie are beasts at the bar!! I’m never disappointed here!

Wow.  Best steak I have ever had, hands down.  Cooked to perfection.  The drinks were strong and the service was impeccable.  Make sure you are dressed.  We were not planning to have dinner the night we went, so I felt a little out of place.  I'm pretty sure they seat people not dressed to their standards in the bar...lol... no matter.  We had a great dinner and honestly, the lounge is more my speed anyway.  They had a guy playing the piano, quick access to drinks, and a TV so my husband didn't miss any sports.  Pretty sure it's the most expensive meal we have ever had- but 10/10 would do it again.

Very nice wait staff and food. The Waiter had was very friendly and helpful. He always made sure our drinks stayed full and brought us plenty of bread. My wife ordered a caesar salad and it was very well done. The dressing and toppings were evenly spread. Many places server salads with just clumps of dressing in one spot but, this was not the case. The steaks were very good. I love raw steak and the first steak I ordered I requested "Ultra rare" came to me medium. I sent it it back and the next steak I got was the best steak I'd ever eaten in my life. The meat was so tender, it was like cake batter or butter. My knife went through the steak without any resistance. It was so tender, you didn't have to nearly chew it. The seasonings were perfect on the top. The french fried onions on the top provided a nice contrast to the meat and made for a perfect topping. My wife ordered the Cajun New York Strip in a cast iron skillet. She absolutely loved it. The marinade and seasonings on the outside matched well with the excellent cut of meat. The only thing she would have done differently was order the steak a few levels rarer because the skillet will continue to cook the steak. The side we ordered was Au Gratin Potatoes. It was also enjoyable, but the cut of the potatoes was not what I was expecting. I expected more of a thin slice and this was more along the lines of cubed potatoes or hashbrowns. Nothing really was negative about the entire dining experience. While Stab's Prime was somewhat pricey, our total bill was only around $120 without tip. I have no problems paying a for an expensive meal, if the meal is worth it. This was absolutely worth it. Excellent way to spend my birthday and I look forward to my next visit.

The service is impeccable.  This was my first time visiting Stab's and I will be going back in the future.  The food was cooked perfectly and the portion was very reasonable. The ambience was very nice.  The light quality was perfect, not too low and not too high.  The noise level was perfect. It was apparent that everyone was socializing,  but there was no really loud talking. The restaurant was easy to walk through and the smell of food didn't suffocate the social atmosphere.  I loved it!  It was perfect!

name: Phil's Oyster Bar & Seafood Restaurant
address: 4335 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: THE ABSOLUTELY BEST chargrilled oysters I have ever had! Leroy prepared them phenomenally, no pieces of shell, juicy, cooked to perfection. Dana, our server was awesome and recommended my crab meat augratin Pizzaza. Not a lot of you have large appetite, super flavor, very rich. My wife had the shrimp and spinach dip, also very good. Lastly I had the white chocolate bread pudding, custard texture, delicate in flavor, not too sweet. First time customer, feel foolish for not having come here years sooner!

This place is LEGIT! Fresh raw oysters, great Bloody Marys, and the sauteed crab claws were right on point! Classy style sports bar that is a staple in the neighborhood, and has been serving customers since 1950. If you want good service, good food, and a cold brew with your seafood Phil's is a must! Monday nights is 50 cent oyster night and would make a great way to enjoy any game. I will definitely be coming back!

This place is fantastic! Service was great Dana was our server. The oysters were so good! I highly recommend Phil's. The food was amazing the service was fantastic it wasn't crowded when they has 50 cent oysters! Will visit whenever I'm in town.

Nice restaurant. Friendly staff. Good atmosphere. I like how they allow you to make your own cocktail sauce for your raw oysters and control the intensity. Tried the crawfish cheesecake. Don't know how to describe it but it had a good flavor.

Phil's food is the best Baton Rouge has to offer. I hear there's a new out of town oyster restaurant coming to BR from over New Orleans way. Well they had better bring their A-Game because Phil's Char Broiled Oysters are cooked perfectly and are absolutely outstanding! Now, I have eaten the char broiled oysters at the other mentioned restaurant many times and they are good. I'll put Phil's up against them any time. I also had the Shrimps Piazza...OMG. it is fried shrimp abundantly topped with crab meat and cheese.. Fabulous! Also, are you ready for this? The dressings are all house made. I had the absolute best blue cheese dressing I have ever tasted. They also have fabulous specialty bar drinks and beer in a frosted mug. There is nothing fancy here. It is an oyster / sports restaurant and bar. So, if you don't want fancy and do what some of the best food you've ever tried, Try Phil's. Our service was also outstanding.

name: Portobello's Grill
address: 7622 Old Hammond Hwy, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: Great food, great service! Didn't get photos of food but we had the napa salad ( approx $12) and chicken fried chicken ( approx $14)biscuits and they were both delicious. Bottled domestic was $4. Bottomless mimosas were $10. Bloody May's were $8 pc and really good. Place was clean ( posted pictures of that). We were there for a large and loud birthday party and it was a good time. Gabby managed the staff like a boss and staff was pleasant! 👏👏 great first experience

This was a wonderful dining experience. Amanda treated us kindly and gave genuine and knowledgeable advice on the menu. The shrimp scampi was divine and was rich with lemon in the sauce. Portion sizes were nice, and we left full in both body and heart.

We went for brunch and it was a rather large group of us, so a wait was expected. However, you would think that with the wait time, the food would be piping hot. Although my meal was seasoned well, it arrived to me lukewarm, which was unacceptable due to the fact that my table had a longer than usual wait(two staff members came at separate times and apologized for this, which I appreciated). The staff overall was friendly and attentive so for that I give them 3 stars. My suggestion to anyone going for brunch - get there as early as you can.

The brunch food is good but the service is nearly nonexistent. We got a bottomless mimosa and a coke and over 45 minutes we had to flag our waitress down to order food and to get a coke refill (never saw another mimosa after the first) as well as flag someone else down for the check. Meanwhile the wait staff was talking and messing around by the host's counter and behind the bar. I'm sure I've had worse service, I just can't remember when and definitely not for a $46 brunch.

My wife and I attended around 1330 (1:30pm) on a Saturday. It was not real busy at the time we arrived. I ordered the Twin Medallions and the wife got the chicken parm. We also split an order of bread with pesto and finished it all with some bread pudding. So the medallions were very tender and tasted great. The sauce on the medallions was a bit strong but paired nicely with the potatoes. The chicken parm was good but nothing spectacular. The bread and pesto were great. The bread pudding was not that good. The pudding was to soft, sauce was a joke, and the banana slices were from a banana that was still VERY green. Overall the food and experience was good.

name: Downtown Seafood & Grill
address: 130 3rd St, Baton Rouge, LA 70801, USA
reviews:
The fried oyster is so good. The staffs are also so nice and friendly. She gave us free samples to try (which helped a lot in decision making).

Really worth visiting to fill your hungry tummy! 😋
The fish and shrimp were fried too hard, but the fries were good. The cashier who took my order was extremely nice and very welcoming. The salad was okay, nothing to relish over.

My first visit I ordered seafood platter i was speechless everything was perfect. My second visit I ordered the cheeseburger fully dressed add bacon #OMG its huge #booyah 💪🔥💯 I loved it, The amazing  staff is very friendly and services was speedy. I also give them 5 stars for cleanliness and clientele👏

Great food and lots of it for a reasonable price.  The service is fast and friendly.  The location is fantastic but I feel like the inside decor could be improved on to help with the overall experience.
It's a nice quick bite. Like fast food restaurant. Staff is really friendly, overall good experience. Food could've been fresher but still pretty good.

name: Mestizo Louisiana Méxican Cuisine
address: 2323 S Acadian Thruway, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Nicer atmosphere, high end menu options. Delicious, but pricey. Specialized menus include Keto, Vegetarian and Gluten free. Large portion sizes. Enjoyed our lunch before the game!

Must visit one of the best Mexican cuisine in Baton Rouge.  This is one of the small hidden gems for Mexican food.  The restaurant is very clean and quiet.  Very friendly staff who will help you with the menu. The chef/owner is very friendly.  The food the amazing and to die for. Best seafood Mexican dish in Baton rouge.  
Must visit this location.

They're ok. I love Mexican food and I understand they're trying to be on the classier scale. However, the few times I've eaten there, it's just been kind of bland. Not bad, not good. There are just better options. The place itself is nice, though.

Came from out-of-town and this restaurant BLEW ME AWAY!!!! They have some very creative dishes that are out of this world! I've never experienced a restaurant like this one. Trust the chef. I almost ordered my mashed cauliflower and eggs without the sauce because it sounded weird together. Nope. The flavors blended perfectly! The menu is extremely creative and they literally have a section for everyone - including Paleo, low-carb, vegetarian, and low-fat. The owner came to our table and when I asked about the cauliflower mash, he brought me a sample. Heaven!!! Brunch was so good we came back the next day for lunch.

The food was amazing. My family and I went for Father's Day since my dad loves the food here. We brought two 3 for 2 fajita plates and the cuatro and it fed 7 people including a child. The chef took care of us and made us feel at home. The waitress was very professional and patient. I love the vibe and the artwork. Will definitely come back!

name: Cecelia Creole Bistro
address: 421 N 3rd St Suite B, Baton Rouge, LA 70802, USA
reviews: New to town and walked here for dinner. Sat at the bar and ordered the Steak with potatoes and fresh veggies also added a side of shrimp. I had high hopes for the place considering it was walking distance from my place. The food came fairly quick but the shrimp were no longer warm, even tried them first as I know shrimp cool rather quick. Ordered the steak medium but was really only able to eat around the edges as the middle was still completely raw. Was never once asked how my meal was or the steak was cooked to the temperature I requested. Other than that the potatoes and veggies were hot and very good. Uncertain if I’ll return.

Went to Cecelia Creole Bistro during restaurant week. This was my first visit.  I had the BBQ rubbed pork ribeye on top of a bed of White Rice and black beans. And my dinner date had the Shrimp and Grits.  We both enjoyed our dishes.  The pork ribeye was cooked to perfection.   It was perfectly seasoned and so juicy.   The rice and beans was very flavorful and complimented the pork rib very well.  My dinner date said his shrimp and grits was very good, seasoned well and tasted so good. 

The prices on the menu was very very reasonable The atmosphere was very trendy and nice.  We would definitely visit again.
Food was very tasty and hearty. Staff was friendly and professional. Not giving it 5 stars because it was a bit pricey (particularly the short ribs) for what you get.
Great spot for some fresh local cuisine.  Shrimp and Grits were amazing.  Wonderful service - so good I had to bring my friends all back for dinner.  Loved it.
Very welcoming, the food is delicious. I had the Redfish Cecelia and my husband had the Pork chop dish.

name: Simple Joe Cafe
address: 3057 Government St, Baton Rouge, LA 70806, USA
reviews: Not enough stars. Great atmosphere!! Food is outstanding. Got to get the grits!! Omlettes are huge!!! Service is professional and make it personal that they appreciate you have come to eat with them. The music could be rage against the machine then frank Sinatra. Simple Joe is simply great. Check them out!!

The food is just down right good.

My first time to Simple Joes, I walk in and I’m ordering to go.

If you have eyes that work, you know just what to do, so I walk up and place my take out order and the counter.

I’m not really sure where to stand at this point, so I position myself somewhere off to the side of the growing line to order; somewhere between ‘in the way’ and ‘in the way’.

After a fair wait, my food is ready. It’s hot and smelling tasty, and after a quick inspection by the head honcho, it’s missing an item. A quick fix, and I’m on my way.

The coffee is delicious, they serve it up fresh and you make it yourself— my preference.

French toast was bomb, eggs were bomb, salmon bagel was bomb. No complaints.

If you’re in the neighborhood, definitely stop in. It’s just tasty stuff.

Landed in Baton Rouge early and starving. Looked up "best breakfast in Baton Rouge", this place came up. It absolutly nails it! Super good food, friendly vibe, Joe is super nice and passionate about his business. We had his famous grits, chili, french toast and more, awesome! We will be back!

One of a kind experience. Super busy! You stand online to order, then take a seat with a number. There was a lot of confusion on tickets, but in my opinion, it added to the unique charm. Food is amazing. Very homey, get your own refills kind of place.

Classic, very delicious, breakfast food. Everyone that works here is very nice as well. Heather, one of the owners, is very personable and remembers your name! Good place to get a quick bite, meet with friends or business partners,  and to study.

name: Dempsey's Poboys
address: 13580 Coursey Blvd, Baton Rouge, LA 70817, USA
reviews: Fried shrimp and catfish is delicious. My wife and I enjoyed the gumbo. Service with a smile and will not let you down. I will definitely be going back.
One of my favorite places when I come to town! Love their grits!
Feels like a small town diner!  Staff is always quick to great you.  Love all the food.

I love the fact that Dempsey's has a meatless poboy!! I wish you guy would start selling a fried cauliflower poboy.  Everything was delicious we were all satisfied and the waitress was very nice. They were really busy and still gave great service.
My favorite Little Gem everything on the menu is absolutely delicious there is never a disappointment and you have to check out the daily specials!

name: Drusilla Seafood Restaurant
address: 3482 Drusilla Ln D, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: A new reason to come to Baton Rouge! I used to think Louisiana Lagniappe was alone as my favorite but this Drusilla is outstanding. The hush puppies were like nuggets from heaven. The  fish (Drum) smothered in some butter sauce was done to perfection. I then ordered some bread pudding to go and it did not disappoint. Wonderful food at a manageable price!

It was all good.  Hush puppies were crispy on outside and soft in side, with fresh butter it was delicious. The fried oysters and shrimp were good. My mother had the stuffed flounder which she really liked. We have been before and will visit again.
This place reeks of ambience. I absolutely adored the dark wood everywhere.in fact, the only thing I liked more than the ambience was the absolutely amazing food. Everything was completely top notch!
My family and I enjoyed a very special evening here recently. We were treated very well in this beautiful place. Everyone loved their food as well.
Not as good as they used to be but they still have decent lunch specials and delicious hush puppies (when they’re fresh)

name: Digiulio Brothers Italian Cafe
address: 2903 Perkins Rd, Baton Rouge, LA 70808, USA
reviews: Atmosphere and service were fantastic. Wine was delicious but the food didn’t quite meet the high expectations from referrals. Hearty portion though!  Would go back
Just the nicest family atmosphere with stellar, authentic Italian food, thoughtful wine pairings, a charming patio and dimly lit romantic interior. Chicken parm & red velvet cake is a must!
First time ordering here.  My eggplant parmesan came with spaghetti, salad and bread.  From phone through pick up I am impressed with the courtesy, food and will be back!
This restaurant was simply perfect. Excellent dinner, excellent service. All on Valentines day. Great job. I will be back soon. Finally found perfect Italian dining. Thanks to the staff.

The food, service, and environment were exceptional. I had the lasagna and meatball and my only complaint is that it was HEAVY on the red sauce. I scraped a lot off and then had some left. They only take RSVP on Valentine's Day and New Year's Eve so we did have to wait for a minute but that was our fault. Overall a great experience! I will be going back.

name: Texas Roadhouse
address: 10360 N Mall Dr, Baton Rouge, LA 70809, USA
reviews: First things we love the rolls and butter. The wait is not to long. Our food is always good and the staff works hard to wait on us. The drinks are good. I think they put enough liquor in them. We always enjoy our outing at Texas Roadhouse!

Really good burgers.

Good selection of menu items.  Could have a few more beers on tap.

Friendly and well versed staff about the menu.  They also stayed on top of things.

Good deal of seating and the place was almost full. 

Plenty of parking but this place is popular so it can fill up fast.

Waiter was wonderful and the food equally as excellent. If you're entire party hasn't arrived, you have to wait until everyone arrives to be seated. Bread rolls and shelled peanuts are complimentary. Some dishes were very salty, however, overall experience was pleasant.

The food was amazing. The bread was great as always. Our server was good but I would recommend she doesnt blame everything on her coworkers or in the fact that the restaurant is busy. If you dont see the customer upset no need to give explanations where no one ask for. If we ask for something is only to help you remember not to imply that we are angry. She was a sweetheart but a lot of servers are like this nowadays.

First 2 pics are from Valentine's day 2020, in Louisiana for our 10yr anniversary & he set this all up to make sure while we were over in Louisiana seeing the Pelicans & Zion play the Oklahoma Thrashers that we had this mushy romantic thing going on & so, the last 2 pics are from North Carolina in Nov. of 2018 but it was again a Duke basketball game to see Zion Williamson, Tray Jones, Joey Baker, & Jack White & the rest of the Blue Devils, but this is how romantic he is, this was our very first ever lunch date in February of 2010 & we having been going strong ever since.
